review: This has been an excellent experience. NICOLE was our waitress and she was just the best. Polite, helpful, cheerful, listens and most of all its crazy because it's her first day. When you come here ask for service from Nicole.  This aside, I got the CARNE ASADA pizza and I would say it was a 5 out of 5. My wife ordered a shrimp scampi pizza that one is the way to go 5 out of 5. Beer was good, atmosphere was nice.  So to wrap this all up Nichole 6 star review, the food 5 and the environment is a 5.  I'll be back!!

This is honestly the worst California Pizza Kitchen I've EVER been to. My family and I have been loyal customers of CPK for years at various locations. We keep coming back because we really enjoy their food, especially their pizzas. I have no complaints about the food here- it was great and tasted as it usually does. My main issue with this place was their poor customer service (or lack thereof). We walked in for a late lunch and everything was wrong from the very beginning. The host and hostess at the front were very unprofessional, incompetent, and not very friendly. Despite having 50% of the tables empty, they took awhile to seat us. When both of them finally decided to seat our party of 5 (because it is SO hard, right?), the solution they came up with was to put 2-two seater tables together (two chairs and a booth seat), which was clearly small for 5 adults. We didn't complain because we were just hungry. Right when we got seated, we felt rushed by the waitress to have our orders ready and then told her to give us a few minutes. I guess she must've felt annoyed because that's when the service went really downhill. She disappeared until we had to wave her down several times, slammed our dishes on the table when our dishes were ready, and spoke with an attitude. I guess she decided to get her act together later during our time there because she came back to refill our waters throughout the meal with a disingenuous facade of friendliness. I didn't appreciate her attitude, and this location was clearly all over the place, starting with the host and hostess. It is clear on their Yelp page that many Yelpers also experienced their poor customer service. I guess that can only be a reflection of their manager. I'm not tough about customer service; I really appreciate servers that are nice and we usually end up tipping them well. However, I can't stand rude employees, especially when our party has a lunch bill of close to $100. I expect better.

I came in with my family after watching Disney On Ice. The restaurant is local to the arena so it's understandable that they would be busy. Now we have experienced a few issues.  1. The host told us that the wait was going to be about 20 minutes. We checked around with other local restaurants and the wait was about the same so we decided to wait. We went to check in after 30 minutes of not being called and they said another 20 minutes to which we were furious because the kids were hungry.  2. We sat with the kids and ordered for them right away. We also ordered the waters for everyone. It seems like we got their pizzas an hour later :/ they were super hungry and started giving us a hard time  3. I ordered the steak which was the most expensive item on their menu. I ordered it medium and got it well. I gave it back and ordered the chicken and season veggies. The chicken was super dry and uneatiable. I was so disappointed. I finally order the classic Caesar which you really can't get wrong and it was good.  Overall I was very disappointed in this location. It seemed like everything that can go wrong did :/

Been coming here for 10 years never had a bad experience from cpk the company alone but this location it's self was the worse experience ever I love this place I bring my daughter and order a kids pasta and pizza and the server has the nerve and try to tell me I can't order the two items because she thought it was for me and there is supposedly a 10 year and younger age to get the items then she had the worse attitude and rolled her eyes at me ! Managers in this location need to check there servers attitude and how they are supposed to have customer service on how they treat us as customers especially when we have are family here present !!   I can again new year 2018 and I get the worse service again and they took 35 min to give me my child's food and then the waiter just assumed that I didn't want anything and they still charge me for my kids meal
Love the service and the food. Menu has such a variety and the people makes this place. Fonzie is the coolest
I went enter and seat and I waited for 20 or more min no water and no waiter show up for me and there is many waiter but I decide leave and nothing happy about it

Came here for their Avocado Club Egg Rolls and ordered their Sedona Tortilla soup. The egg rolls were great! If you love avocados this is definitely a must while you dine here. The soup was okay, kind of on the sweet side because of the corn they have in it. Again, if you love avocados I would recommend asking for a side of it to put in the soup as well! Makes it taste delicious! :)  Overall I'm giving this place four stars for the rolls!

I love their salads and soup- but DO NOT order a steak here. Waitress recommended the ribeye steak. When it came out I maybe had 3 edible bites since the steak was ALL fat. Not trimmed at all. See picture  No one seemed to care as they took away my full plate of fat.

After checking into our hotel, we walked a couple blocks to have dinner here. SERVICE: It wasn't very busy around 6 pm on a Sunday and service fine.  Our server (forgot her name) was friendly and came by a number of times to check on us, refill water glasses, etc.  FOOD: After having a late lunch we weren't very hungry, so just ordered a few smaller things to share.  Fried M&C appetizer ($4.99).  Crispy outside, softer inside, they weren't very cheesy, but still  tasty.  Not sure what the sauce was on the plate, it added very little flavor. Petite Wedge salad ($4.99).  Pretty simple but really good, loved the bacon and tomato. Bowl of Sedona Tortilla soup ($6.99).  Except for the tortilla strips on top, it looked pretty bland.  However it had some great "southwest" flavors going on.  Not as good as some others I've had, but still pretty tasty. OVERALL: Went on a slow evening for a light meal. Got good service, good food and a reasonable price, even though it wasn't pasta or a pizza.  A nice experience overall.

My first time here and was honestly not worth it pizza was like cardboard pizza $5 dominos pizza would have been waaaaay better! Also tried the Mac n cheese and had to give it back it tasted worse then the box Mac n cheese at home. Sorry not sorry. Although the service was ok.

Always serving up good food and great hospitality!   Casey is taking care of us at the bar.  We love the Sicilian pizza but tried the fish tacos - they were sooooo good!!  Always start with the buffalo cauliflower appetizer (YUM!!). Brian is busy in the dining room -we would sit in his section except we love to sit at the bar.  Sorry Brian! The manager Luke is like a maestro of a symphony, checking every dish, making sure that everything flows smoothly. Love coming here on Thursday or any day.  But tonight we needed to enjoy Friday Eve and CPK took really good care of us!!!

Broken pizza oven....hostess said we we can order anything but "PIZZA" at California "PIZZA" Kitchen! Hmmm.... They sat us with server Travis...and his service is over the top sarcastic.  Be prepared for bad jokes the whole process from ordering drinks to getting your bill.  Very unprofessional.

This CPK is located in Long Beach outlet. You can't really go wrong with CPK as they are everywhere. I love their pizza personally since they have pizzas with thin crusts. I usually get the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza, which has skinless chicken breast, red onion, gouda cheese, mozzarella, and cilantro. The only downside is that service can take a while and food can take a while as well. However, other than that food is alright and they have a great atmosphere.

I've heard of California Pizza Kitchen, but had never tried it before, waking in, it wasn't at all how I expected it to be. My impression was that it was a casual eatery, but it felt more upscale than that. The staff were friendly and chatty, and didn't miss a beat, and helped us with our selections. The deep fried mac and cheese balls were the perfect starter,  and we shared a spaghetti dish and a pizza. It was all cooked to perfection, and tasted delicious, very happy with my experience.

My friend took me here one afternoon and it was a delight. The carne asada pizza was so delicious and I ordered a strawberry dessert at the end. This is definitely a must try and they have a wide variety to select from, very healthy, service is great.

Decided to visit this place today for lunch. Turn off number one; the greeter who sat us Placed the dirty menu on top of our clean plates. That's yucky so everyone who has touched a menu now their germs are on my Plate. My friend and I decided to order the lunch special which is located on the back of the menu. We selected a turkey sandwich, salad, and one of the beverages located in section three (the mango). The glass was filled to the top with ice and probably about 3 oz of actual liquid content. When asked for a refill we were told it was not complimentary. Well heck the non complementary price should have been noted on the back of the menu near the beverages selection. also you should not fill the entire glass up with ice. I guess this is a way that the restaurant profits right. Service mediocre. I will not return to this location

Service was one of a kind.. host was understanding of us requesting a booth and has a no problem attitude. Server (didn't get his name) had refills before we asked. Also, when ordering the carne asada pizza he said they didn't have carne asada but if we wanted to try it with Tri tip and that did the trick! The pizza experience was still amazing and everything we expected. Ordered butter cake and came out right on time. We'll be coming back. So far our favorite local CPK.

CPK is always a safe option. The pike location is super convenient to downtown and the water front of Long Beach. This location is also directly across the street from the convention center, so it can get really busy. Service isn't always the fastest, remember it's made to order pizza.

I haven't been to CPK since I was In New York almost 6 years ago. Its interesting to see the change in direction and the pizza is not really the main attraction. My mrs and some friends of mine came here before heading to Cinemark at the pike (One of my favorite theaters in California) and I enjoyed it. Very much. We got a the original bbq chicken chopped salad, and chicken tequila fettuccine. We also got a fresh strawberry mango cooler and butter cake for desert.  Let me tell you it was all delicious. The Mango cooler was super addicting and I almost drank the whole thing without noticing. My Mrs and I share everything and for the size of both portions, we surprisingly finished everything. Thats the great thing about chain restaurants, they churn out huge portions. You can't really go wrong coming to this CPK. You'll seriously get some good food!

Not being a "chain person", we went here with incentive from a free entree offer we got in the mail.  Our server Robin was top notch.  She is great at her job- very attentive.  The manager is well organized and utilizes his staff efficiently.  The chef brought out our appetizer- SZECHWAN CHICKEN DUMPLINGS, which was a nice touch.  The manager assisted our server with our entrees- THE ORIGINAL BBQ CHICKEN CHOPPED SALAD and CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINE.  We didn't follow directions on our free entree, but the manager credited us the $15 anyways.  All the food was fresh and flavorful.  Parking is metered around the Pike, but luckily we are in walking distance.
Due to poor and inconsistent staff training I will no longer be coming back to this CPK. Which is unfortunate because I get take out about once a week.  Food is good, manager is not.
WORST MEAL EVER!  Bad food bad service, our server even told us "sorry we ran out of silverware" and walked away

Dinner at CPK was delicious. We enjoyed the Halibut and the shrimp pasta with zucchini ribbons. We sat at the counter in front of the pizza oven sipping on a La Crema wine flight. Casey, our server, was friendly, personable and made great menu suggestions. An asset to CPK. My only desire is that my home town of Reno had a CPK!

I love CPK. I love that they have a large menu with many choices. This location is really nice. The staff are really friendly and always make sure you have everything you need. My favorite dish has to be the chicken picatta... but I also love the tequila lime chicken and their margherita pizza. Delicious!! I will definitely return next time I'm in the area.

Went on a Saturday evening and my group of 4 was seated right away. There is a nice selection of both food and drinks. We had a bottle of wine for the table and the chips and guacamole for an appetizer. It was more of a salsa than guacamole. It was basically a small pile of chopped veggies (onions/corn/beans/tomatos) mixed in a small amount of avocado. It wasn't a bad dish, just not what any of us thought it would be and the chips weren't very fresh. As far as main dishes go, we all enjoyed out meals. I had a half order of the roasted veggies salad and it was delicious! Unless you're starving I recommend half orders of the salad. They're a good size and you won't feel stuffed after, especially if you want to try an appetizer to begin with.

Visited this location yesterday, the two pizzas we ordered were OK, but sorely lacking in protein/chicken, especially for the exorbitant price. There are too many other options that give you way more for a better price like pieology and some of the others. Our bill was almost $100 for four people to have lunch and only one beer was ordered. No appetizers or anything else. I noticed that the up charge for anything extra also. Service was good and over all the food quality is good, but I wouldn't go back due to the three pieces of chicken on both pizzas and lack of value.

I have never once written a review on Yelp but I've had an awful day and going to this place was the last straw. My day started at 7am with getting off a fantastic cruise and quickly took a turn. As I made my way up the parking structure and neared my car, I noticed that the rim and tire were completely missing. As I got closer, I realized THEY WERE ALL GONE. Obviously, it's going to take me a little longer to get home that I thought. I start by trying to talk to Carnival Cruise ship people(useless) to get this sorted out but they could not care less even though this was in their parking garage. They tell us that they only have security 5 days a week and this happened while there was no one there. How ridiculous right? So we get no help from them cause they're POS. We can't have it towed because it's in a parking garage and the clearance is too low. We can't have it pulled out of the garage any other way so we have to call a tire place so we can pick out some tires and have them brought back to put on our vehicle. Let me tell you, this tire place went above and beyond. AMERICAN TIRE DEPOT! So amazing! They were making calls for us, giving us rides everywhere, even offered us donuts. We finally pick out our tires and rims and head back to the car. Guess what, the GD rims don't fit because the holes don't line up. The family is heated man let me tell you. So the only thing left to do get a rental car and call it a day. AMERICAN TIRE DEPOT hooked it up with a rental car! They tell us it will be a few hours but it ends up being longer than that so we have to get a hotel. In the meantime we went to Yardhouse(fav of mine) and had a late lunch. We checked into MAYA HOTEL - by DOUBLE TREE which is also amazing. Super beautiful! After a few hours of relaxing after a long and ridiculous day, the wife and I decide to order some CPmfK. I order the usual, Garlic Creme Fettucine, which is absolutely delicious. The wife orders a chicken Caesar salad because she wanted something light but she can eat what she wants because she is the most gorgeous being on the earth. We drive to pick this up by the way because we're tired after this long day and of course there's no parking. Fix that s-it CPK. Anyways, I go to pick it up and it smells great so I'm super excited. I get back to the car after my mile long walk since there's no parking and head home. We get back and look in the bag and THERE'S 0 bread. The best bread I've ever had is from CPK and they neglected to put any in our take out bag when we even asked "will we get bread?" and the lady responded, and I quote "yes." Now, normally this wouldn't be an issue but on today of all days I've had it. I'm sick of being deceived and lied to and this was the breaking point. I don't know what her name was but she was the messed up cherry on top of the poop cake. Don't get me wrong, the food was great, always is. However, after the day I had this place only gets 3 stars from me. Thank you! -Dyl

I ate here the other night (Friday) and got the spaghetti and asparagus with chicken. It tasted pretty good however the next day I was feeling really sick all day and last night it finally all came out. I had to miss a day of work at my new job! Anyways, just a warning, I don't think this place handles food the way it's supposed to be handled. Also the service was terrible and the waitress kept saying "it just wasn't her night." Just a warning, eat at your own risk.

Super friendly and great service. Our server Justin was great and the person who made our drinks even came to the table and asked us how our drinks were.  Had the shrimp scampi pizza it was delicious!!!  Lots of shopping done after :)

Fantastic service from Josh and Tom last night.  They were short staffed and provided a great time and excellent food. I will be using them as an example when I do preshift meetings with my kitchen next week. Thank you for the awesome time.

Exceptional service! Wow! I came here yesterday for dinner with my girl friend and it was our first time coming to any California pizza kitchen. Our host gave us a warm welcome and seated us almost immediately. We told him it was our first time so we listened to his suggestions and they were so good! Right after he seated us Evan our server took our orders. He was soooo funny and entertaining I never had such a great server like him. Great job, we will be coming back again soon! We ordered a Sicilian flat pizza with pineapples as an extra topping and crunchy Mac and cheese on the side. We finished it off with a pumpkin cheesecake. Yum!

By far one of the best customer service I have ever experienced.. I work in the food service industry as well, and I'm very very impressed with the level of passion and professionalism. Marco Sanchez the Kitchen Manager went above and beyond to satisfy me as a customer.. Jason the cashier who assisted us was beyond amazing in customer engagement and satisfaction. I highly recommend this location. #5stars
Tried their rib eye steak and halibut. My god that rib eye was freaking delicious!!!! The nice manager was very nice and helpful and so were the staff. I'm very pleased with the food and service!

I like some CPK! Forget the BS*** the Silcion Pizza with a side BBQ chicken Salad is a go go! Must try it. The only downside is the parking! You have to find street parking or walk allllll the way from the structure! Also, its not worth $36 for a handtossed pizza and full BBQ chicken salad. If it was $15 lesser, it would of gotten 4.5 stars but I guess its the times we live in.

Life-changing experience. They went above and beyond. Made me feel like I had real friends in this world and they don't even know my name. Food was great. I ordered off their secret menu with no problems whatsoever! They saved my life. I'm a customer forever. You've got to try what's cookin' in this California Pizza Kitchen!

I want to start by saying our waiter was great (I can't recall his name he was in his 20s Asian), our experience started off rough and he tried his best despite the circumstance. This review has nothing to do with our Waiter. My boyfriend and I  arrived Saturday April 30th, the hostess sat us at an elevated table near the take out pick up area. This is where the struggle began, we sat there for 15 minutes, multiple waitresses walked by stared and kept moving. Finally I flagged one down and said we have been here a really long time and have not been helped, plus we need a gluten free menu (the bf has the alergy). That young woman was in process of delvering another tables food. But she told another waitress, a blonde either a big black bow she looked at our table and obviously didn't want to deal. The orginal girl I flagged down she had dark brown hair then found the young man who ended up helping us. He informed us that our table doesn't have an assigned waiter /Waitress it's a pool area and apparently no one let anyone know we needed help. Well no one other than us flagging people down. Knowing we were anoyed the young man was awesome for helping us, especially after the blonde with the bow ignored us, she probably figured shev wouldn't get a tip since we sat unassisted for 15 minutes.  We ordered drinks my bf got a Agave lime margarita no salt, I ordered the strawberry lime margarita. The bartender messed up and made mine without the salt rim,  and my bf had salt. So those had to go back, I saw them pour my bf in a new glass, then mine in his old salted glass. Bf at this point wanted to get up and walk out, I said no which was my bad we should have left.  The pizzas come his gf one was good.  Mine was cold we had so many issues I didn't want to say anything because my bf was about to reach the lose his chill level of annoyed. The manager was obviously aware but because he seemed to circumnavigate our table when making his rounds to other customers and asking how they were doing he obviously did not care since he never came to our table. So it was clear he was trying to avoid us. The only saving grace of this place was our waiter, he was super friendly aplogetic,  and even got us a discount due to all the  mishaps. Management sucks, they need to be sure waitresses /waiters are informed of customers dining in a pooled area, abd actually try to rectify am issue and approach a table. Management never interacted with us
My review is for my waiter Travis... We loved him. Next time we come I will have to sit in his section. Helpful and super fun. Food is good butter cake is bomb!! Travis made our day!
The new menu has arrived at this CPK location! The food is beyond amazing and the staff is great! We always know we will get great good & great service at CPK! Until next time Long Beach!!

I am giving this a 3 star review. I visited twice in two days (because the first visit was so good). The second visit was zero stars.  First visit was outstanding. Aside from them not having enough waitstaff and having to wait a long time to be seated, once we were seated, lunch was terrific. I ordered something that is no longer on their everyday menu-the Blt pizza. I had been craving one, and they graciously whipped it up. Other folks in my party were pleased with their food as well.  Second visit, not so good. We were seated right away. Our server had a very strange sense of humor and he thought he was funny. I didn't find him funny, and when I heard him say the same line to the table behind us that just sat down after us, I figured that this was a line he used often. Frankly, most of us are in long beach for pleasure, and we don't want to hear, about how we are having a better time than him And he doesn't want to get into it. If you don't like your job, then you should not be in the business!  That was the first bad.  Second, our food took 40 minutes to come out. After asking the server what was up, he went and checked. Said it would be a few more minutes. Finally, it arrived and so did the manager to apologize. He said they got slammed today and ran out of chicken. I was completely annoyed at this time and when he offered free dessert or free appetizers on our next visit, I just said no thank you.  Third bad once we started eating. One dish was fine, but the other was completely inedible. The chicken was petrified like it was microwaved. Obviously it was to quick thaw it. I asked the server to take it back and to take it off the bill.  The Save:  the manager came over again and apologized. He graciously comped the entire meal.  Three stars because he showed concern and that he cared about satisfying us. I have been in other places where management wouldn't even show their face when they knew they were wrong.
Food is usual CPK and Travis Mitchell is fantastic. Better service than you get at a 5 * restaurant. Thanks pal!

We came in for a late lunch after going to the Aquarium of the Pacific. It was a little packed since it was Memorial Day but only about a 20-25 min wait. We put our party's name down with the hostess and sat down on the seats right next to the front counter.  When our table was ready, a different host/server than the first quickly said our party's name then walked outside to try calling out the name. My friend attempted to get his attention before he was outside but he didn't hear her. When I caught up to him outside, he was already saying the next party's name. I let him know he said our party's name, but before I could let him know we tried catching him before he walked outside, he condescendingly reprimanded me saying something along the lines of, "If YOU HEAR your name being called, you need to actually SAY something." Before I could even explain, he rudely turned/walked away to say the next party's name and another server was leading us to our table.  Our actual server was a nice and lovely woman but the aggressive introduction with Casey (we found out his name because he ended up being a server for a couple tables near us) honestly left a bad taste in our mouths. I used to work in the restaurant industry so I understand there are busy and hectic moments. However, I would never speak to any customer/guest the way he did to us. I really hope this was a rare occurrence and the rest of the staff doesn't handle hosting with the same demeanor.
Very poor service! Waitresses are racist- will  be reporting to better service bureau to investigate. The foods are okay.

Inside the outlets on the back side. Plenty of seating availability so come on in! Super friendly staff, from the hostess in the front, to our waiter and the chef! Everyone greeted us & was exceptionally friendly. My favorite is the thin crust Sicilian pizza! Just perfect, nice & thin & crispy, New York style.  Tried the jambalaya fettuccini & loved it- very spicy & flavorful, loved the shrimp.  The sangria sampler was really good! I couldn't really decide which flavor was better as I liked them all so I suggest ordering the sampler over a glass of one single flavor.

So I will start by saying that I have never been a big fan of CPK. I hadn't gone in years until recently, but this location is near where I work. I went on May 6th, and again today. I had a same server both times and she was awesome. I feel so bad that I can't remember her name!  Today when I went in with a friend we both ordered the shrimp and zucchini scampi. I had a water, she had an ice tea, and we loved the bread so much that we asked for an additional serving. The scampi is SO good and only 550 calories!  When I went in previously, I was with about 8 people. Almost all of us did the lunch personal pizza and salad. I think a couple members of our group did the scampi on that day. Again, it was a great experience. Service was on point, friendly and attentive waitress, and our food came out promptly.  After two good experiences in a row, I may make this my go to lunch spot for work!
Travis is the best server I've ever had. He's an expert in hospitality. The food  as great, good pizza & dessert, but the service was one of a kind.  Definitely will return.
Pizza was really good and enough for two people. Liked the environment especially with outside seating. Good service.

Always a good meal whenever I come here. I recommend the pesto penne pasta with chicken as the main course or the classic BBQ chicken pizza with pineapple. He best appetizer I can recommend is the sesame chicken dumplings. For the finale you have to try the butter cake either with or without the vanilla ice cream scoop. Regardless it's One of the greatest desserts I've ever had.

Had a quick dinner at CPK. The food was good as expected. It was the service that gives it four stars. The staff was friendly and attentive. Quickly took my order and served the food and drinks. My server had great recommendations too. I enjoyed the meal. The location is convenient being next to a mall and theater.

We visit many of the restaurants in the Pike area and CPK is at the top of the list. The head chef Alfonso and his matradee    Casey are class acts. They always make our visits a pleasant dining experience. And the food and wine are always great. So if you're every in the area and are looking for good food to start or close a wonderful evening don't hesitate to visit CPK on Pine Street at the Pike in Long Beach.

Poor service Not attentive They forgot to bring the sauce with the pasta. It was our daughters birthday, they said they would sing happy birthday to her and it didn't happen. It seems like they bank on volume of customers, not good service.

I walked into the restaurant and sat at the bar. I ordered a roasted vegetable salad and a water. About 30 minutes passed and I did not have my order.  I asked the bartender if he could check on my salad and apparently the order had not been put in.  The manager told me he would rush the order.  15 minutes later I walked out because the order was still not ready. This is not the place you want to go to over lunch. It is routinely slow.  Two days ago I called in an order for a roasted vegetable salad.  I arrived 20 minutes later at the time I was told my order would be ready. I asked if I could eat the salad at the bar instead of taking it with me.  The bartender told me I could but the salad still took another 20 minutes.  Even then, the salad had no dressing which I had to make a further request for. Over the past two trips it has taken the restaurant about an hour and a half to get me one roasted veggie salad.  I come here because it's close to work and office staff gave me a gift card to the restaurant.  Even for free, it is not worth it.  Obviously I will not return.

CPK's commitment to premium ingredients, imaginative recipes & their recent rebranding of stores, are remarkable.  Decade over decade, day after day,  they are the 'franchised' restaurant to savor & save-on-calories - from Roasted Brussels Sprouts; to Applewood Smoked Bacon Flatbreads - with sweet caramelized onions, &  goat cheese ( $8.29 ) from tangy strawberry or raspberry lemonades ( sugar free options too); to tasty wood-fired pizzas and cedar-fired salmon. The chain is widely known for its innovative and nontraditional pizzas, such as the "Original BBQ Chicken Pizza", BLT, Thai Chicken, and Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizzas.  All are good. Their statable salads ( sampling Asparagus & Arugula ) are low in calories ( 180 calories  ) and their  12oz USDA Fire-Grilled Ribeye is priced right $26.99.  Consistently good food; applaudably good service; and a good value. At this location, Managers Marco and Alfonso, are the keepers of kindness, and hospitality.  And Casey at the bar, delivers quality customer care.

I hate it here. I'm currently in here. Almost two hours later and we still don't have the check. We waited an hour for our food. It only came out because I finally asked for the manager. Then POOF our food was ready! Shocker! Meanwhile, we used the restroom twice and it is the most disgusting place ever!! Paper everywhere, water leaking from each toilet, none of the stalls had toilet paper. Two out of three toilets were backed up. Disgusting. I told the manager and she simply smiled at me and said "ok thank you." Crazy customer service. I'm still sitting here. We have three children and they clearly have lost it for the last hour. Crying and wanting to go home. I'm right there with them. I want to go home too. If they don't bring my check in the next 5 minutes I will walk out of here. This is ridiculous. Save yourself some time and make your own pizza from scratch at home. It will be quicker. I promise.

Do not do take-away from this location. Rude customer service, slow food prep, cold food, incorrect orders. I have patronized this place on and off for the decade plus they have been open because (1) I like CPK food (2) they are the closest location to me by far and (3) I keep getting lulled into believing that they must have improved their service if they have managed to keep the location open for this long. Bad on me being fooled yet again. No matter how bad your craving is for CPK, choose another location. They *will* get your order wrong, serve it cold and then be rude about it. Do not let your friends talk you into going to this location by saying "it can't be as bad as you remember." It is. So tonight's fiasco involved an 1.5 hour prep time for the food (we ordered via Door Dash) according to the restaurant where the manager said, "well we have been really busy, ok?" No call to let us know that they were behind, no "we are sorry." I bet they do not take 1.5 hours to prepare a meal for a dine-in patron.  Turns out this was not true. Our pizza was cold and congealed and had that sheen of pizza that has been sitting under a salamander for at least an hour. No bread. Lettuce cups with two pieces of spindly lettuce. And a salad with a side of chicken where the chicken strips were squished into a dressing cup barely registering two ounces on the home scale. Post-script - called back and spoke to another manager who agreed we deserved a refund but said that has to be done through Door Dash, but of course there is no way to reach anyone at Door Dash to lodge a complaint. Alfonso said the food was ready within 30 minutes, but in the past when they had customer curbside pick up (they no longer do) the food was never ready on time when I did my own take-out.
Great service from our server at the bar Frank. We stopped in for drinks on a busy Saturday and got our drinks fast. He made my "ultimate bloody mary" perfectly  by the way! A+ service CPK LBC :)

Having eaten a lot of their pizza from the grocery store, I was exited to try one freshly made.  It didn't disappoint.  Had the spicy chipotle chicken.  Son had the garlic chicken. Both of us loved the food.   Our server was really friendly and helpful without being a hassle.  Full of smiles too.  Was also really impressed with how quickly we got our food.   Place was very clean, but it seemed a little loud.  Maybe the open floor plan has something to do with that. Only real complaint is that the drinks (we both just had Cokes) seemed high.  But I have noticed that all over California so it is what it is.   Will definitely hit them up again when I return to Long Beach next time.

5 stars for the delicious food and 5 stars for the outstanding service provided by Roman! My mom and I were so pleased to be greeted at our table by such a happy, accommodating and helpful man.  Food and service always go hand in hand, so knowing that I already love food from CPK, Roman truly made this particular location stand out to me, and he has made it our new go-to CPK from now on. :)

We had the best waitress Veronica.  She was very helpful and great service. We all had awesome dinners.  I had the chicken picatta with finger link potatoes.  the table also had  the Garlic roasted chicken which looked and smelled wonderful.  Everyone that goes must have the Salted Carmel Butterscotch pudding I had mine before the dinner was ever brought out and was in heaven.
Always consistent in quality and taste. Service is stellar - Casey at the bar is awesome. One of our favorite places to go for lunch or dinner. Definitely a keeper on our places to dine.

Sat down looking at the menu then noticed the couple that was seated after us got there drinks already and the waiter was already taking there order. Yet not one person asked us anything. There was also another waitress that walked right by us. I kinda think the waiter was mesmerized buy the other customers dreads. That's why he payed so much attention to them and forgot about us. Decided to leave and go across the way to islands. Service here is much better.

Came here to eat before seeing "split" at Cinemax.  Customer service will exceed your expectations at this location.  Staff is very friendly and consistent.  Very classy/sophisticated atmosphere.  Food and drinks came out in a timely manner and were delicious(per usual).  Random Thought: I like the fact that you can still order your usual pizza/(beer) here and not feel like you're "less than" because you didn't select wine or a cocktail like your other fellow CPK'ers. It still comes out in a sexy glass finished with a fruit un top. WINNNERRRR! With so many other dining options at the Pike (which I've tried)  this is the one I would  recommend overall.

We came here last night for my birthday dinner. I had only been to a California Pizza Kitchen once, a few years ago. I had a good experience then, so I figured this time wouldn't be to bad. Just like their name suggests, they offer pizza dishes as well as pasta dishes. Me and my husband both went for the pasta- the same exact dish actually. We both got the Garlic Parmesan Alfredo. My husband got meat in his, but I decided to go meatless this time. The dish was excellent and delicious. The garlic wasn't too strong and had the right amount of taste to it. The amount of parmesan and creaminess to it was perfect. The dessert section on the main menu at first seemed kind of disappointing with such a small selection, but after we were finished with our meal, our waitress gave us a separate dessert menu that had a few more selections on it. I decided to go with the chocolate souffle with a scoop of vanilla ocean cream.  The cake was good. The chocolate wasn't too sweet or overly rich and the vanilla ice cream added to it was a very nice touch, even if the ice cream does cost extra. My only complaint about the dessert is the price of the extra ice cream added to it. Normally I wouldn't spend $1.75 for just one measly scoop of ice cream, but chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream just go so well together that I couldn't resist. Our waitress foe the evening was incredibly nice and helpful. I believe her name was Randi. She was around whenever we needed a drink refilled and she didn't disappear for long periods of time like other waiters/waitresses do in other restaurants. Plus, she got our check ready for us quickly since we had somewhere to be at 10pm.  Overall, quality of food and service was excellent and I'd definitely be back here again.

Overview: This California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) at the Long Beach pier shopping center (close to the movie theater, H&M, and comedy club) is a beautifully decorated, well run restaurant that no longer showcases its pizzas but focuses on "general" American food like pasta, steak, salads, etc (in the vein of BJs, Cheesecake Factory, and every other American chain). The Establishment: With a new theme of sustainable decorating, this CPK combines modern and rustic together in a fashion that seems to work very well. Lots of glass for views of the pier and a beautiful long bar for singles to mingle. Attentive wait staff, slightly lower than average volume, and a slightly dim atmosphere make it a very nice place to bring a date. Outdoor seating also plentiful and well maintained. The Food: I ordered the jambalaya while my wife ordered the Waldorf salad and we enjoyed both of them, with the salad besting the jambalaya. The jambalaya had shrimp (w/ tails still on), sausage, and a decent amount of spicy kick but what I didn't like about it was the overall burndt taste and the shrimp tails still being on. While I'm sure many foodies enjoy the presentation of tail-on shrimp, I eat somewhat like a vacuum cleaner and non-edible bits slow me down. the Waldorf salad was deliciously fruity, well balanced with the cheese/fruit/greens, and well sized. I wholeheartedly recommend it to everyone. Pricing for both was a bit expensive at a little less than $40 for the entire meal (tip included) but I suppose beach-side property rent and the recent remodel is to blame for the high prices. If you haven't been to a CPK in the past, remember that this is NOT a pizza place anymore. It's a general American restaurant that happened to specialize in pizza a few decades ago. Yes, you can try more than a dozen signature concoctions like truffle oil pizza but the entire selection of pizzas is now relegated to a tiny flap in the menu. Pastas, meat dishes, fish, and gourmet salads are now center stage and pricier than their pizzas. Conclusions: This CPK is a beautifully decorated, general American restaurant (not focused on pizza) that is located in a wonderful section of the Long Beach Pier bordering several attractions like a comedy club, a movie theater, and women's clothing shops. It's great for both families and dates, but it's a bit pricey for what you get.
Excellent service. Had the Tequila Chicken Fettuccine delicious. Waldorf Chicken Salad was Excellent. Kiddos loved there pizza..
Avocado egg rolls and spicy buffalo cauliflower were so good, mushroom Paperoni pizza was also delicious. Waiter Travis made our dining experience so fun and enjoyable, thank you!

Great staff, & management, I sat at the counter & was served immediately, very friendly &  efficient personnel, not just friendly to customers but to each other, co workers, I really appreciate a very busy restaurant with a cool respectful vibe. My margarita pizza was perfect, hit the spot. Wish they had my favorite pizza they serve at CPK in Mexico, topped with arregla.

The food at the day when me and my mom came to visit again was alright. The food doesn't seem as much enthusiastic as the previous visit we had. The corner of the steak is crispy which is something I want however it loose it's quality because of the bitter taste of the grill.  I had the same steak in CPK downtown Los Angeles and I think that time was a lot better than we had yesterday (September 8, 2016).  The service is great and I would like to give a shout out to our server Anissa. She has given us an excellent customer service. As if she already knows our needs and we didn't even have to tell her much about what we want. However, some of the staff doesn't seem to show some enthusiasm. Just like the person who sat us on the table.  The other server, I didn't get her name, also attended to our needs to have the table and seat clean. Also, made sure the seat is dry for to us to sit. Thank you very much.    We will come back some other time.

For reasons that escape me we keep trying to order delivery from this store and each time it's a cluster. Without going into full detail specific instructions about, for example, chicken on the side of the Cobb salad are always ignored. A request for just vegetarian filling for the lettuce wraps, also ignored. I called to ask they make sure bread was included with the order and told it's always included in takeaway orders. Well. Order came. No bread. Called and was told "We're really busy...". This was all told a $65 order, for that money one should have one's order done correctly. For any amount the order should be done correctly. Waiting for a callback from the manager.

Casey is the best server in all of downtown long beach.  Cpk always has quality food at a good price. Beginning to have better and better drinks as well.  Always know cpk is a safe choice. This location is pretty empty except for evenings the convention center has events that end at dinner time. It can get crazy then.  Bread always warm, food comes fast, drinks are made well.

My friend and I circled around LB yesterday in the humid, wet rainy weather trying to find parking and a place to eat before attending a concert. We settled on CPK. Luckily, we found a nearby parking spot on the street and didn't have to walk too far. A hostess held the door open and greeted us as we walked up. We were seated right away. Our super friendly waiter named Brian sparked up small talk with us as he took our orders. He suggested a good alcoholic beverage for my friend, the better soup option for me and even asked the chef to make the field greens salad for me that is no longer on the menu.  As ugly as the weather was and even after Brian shared his experience of being in the LB power outage for 4 days, he was still upbeat, helpful, and directed us to the parking structure and venue we needed to get to for our concert. I totally see why he was wearing a pin that said "trainer". He has an awesome personality and seems to know the menu well.  Thanks, Brian, for the wonderful conversation and good tips...even on one of the ugliest summer days we've had!
I sat at the bar and it was so pleasant to see all the staff working happy and loving their job. The pizza was delicious and came out quick. A+ service.

Whenever the boyfriend and I are in LB we always end up at this CPK for lunch. Even though it's usually busy since its during lunch hour, we usually don't have to wait that long to be seated. The servers are always nice here, great customer service. Food is good and reasonable price !!

If you see a freckled blonde girl w/ a ponytail as the hostess make sure to turn around and save yourself the aggravation. The restaurant was 80% empty and she was freaking out on where to sit a party of 12. My waitress was a bit overwhelmed but really sweet and kind. I won't return to this restaurant. If you're staying at  the Hyatt Regency in Long Beach, you can do much better than California Pizza Kitchen

Stopped in for a late lunch after a movie at the Cinemark.  Ordered the lunch duo and chose the bbq pizza and the spinach and quinoa salad. Pizza was OK, the crust was tough and chewy, however the salad sent my taste buds to the moon - I loved it. The service was overly-friendly today because they had a staff of managers meeting in the restaurant (pointed out by our server) so everyone was hustling and being syrupy sweet and over the top with service - so much so that we kept getting interrupted by numerous different staff questioning if everything was to our satisfaction. It was comical watching the display.   Hopefully if I return there won't be a mini manager convention going on and I can enjoy meal in peace!  lol

My family and I have been going to CPK since the 90s and have always loved it.  But today was the worst experience we have ever had, service-wise.  Our server clearly did not want to serve us, from the moment we sat down.  She never checked in on us to see how our meal was.  It seemed as though we were an inconvenience to her, trying to have lunch.  We will not return to this location.

In the words of my girlfriend, this place is a HOT MESS. The good:  -cobb salad was decent, and i liked the orchard sangria, even though it was more ice than liquid. The bad: -Me and my gf sat at the bar area to be served and there were dirty glasses sitting in front of us for 10 mintues before anyone came to greet us. The bartender/waiter seemed overworked and was running from customer to customer making it difficult to get his attention. Staff was yelling at other staff because of mistakes being made which made it kind of awkward. Just seemed dysfunctional when it got busy. -Food took a while to get to us. When it did the appetizer was forgotten. I asked the server for some ranch which he said he'd bring but never did. Then I asked the bartender/waiter and he had to ask the staff several times before they actually brought it. And bbq chicken pizza was just ok, definitely nothing special or anything I'd ever want again. That might be the chicago in me coming out. For a bill of $50+ I expect alot better. I WONT BE BACK.

Of all the places we could have been for our last meal in 2014, how did we end up at CPK?! Poor planning on our part that's how!  Pine Street restaurants were blocked off and only accessible through the NYE party, Opera Italian of course was booked (bar room only, which was also packed), even Outback Steakhouse was 1.5 hour wait, Famous Dave's an hour wait.  We happen to walk by CPK in our desperate quest for food and behold.. no wait! We're going in.  And as we approached the door, a greeter came and opened it for us.  We were seated right away and our server came to us timely as well.   CPK has always been a long time favorite but I hadn't visited in years in an attempt  to avoid franchised restaurants and mainly, because I forgot how much I loved CPK.  Nothing fancy, just good and satisfying food.  But how could I forget: -  The Chicken Tequila Lime Pasta. One of my favorite dishes.  -  Thai Chicken Pizza.  Small pizza with about 8 small slices perfect for sharing.  Love the peanut sauce, the veggies on top.  Leftovers are great. -  Bacon Avocado Rolls.  Like egg rolls with crispy wonton wrap, bacon, chicken, and avocado inside.  Came with two dipping sauces: ranch and a spicy cream sauce. Gotta love options. Great portion sizes, even had lots of leftovers.  About $100 for our meal.  Great service, attentive waiter.  I know where I'm coming for pizzas now!

Stopped in for lunch with no expectations, wow from entering to leaving the service was impeccable! Food was fantastic, thank you Leo for your professional, kind service!!! We will be back...love the cucumber revivor!!
15 minute wait?  For a table for 2, and restaurant is 25% occupied?  This happened at 11am on a weekday.   Poor service.
Horrible restaurant. Forgot 2 pieces of my order after waiting 25 minutes after my set pick up time. Food was harshly mediocre

CPK at the Pike in Long Beach employee Customer Service is horrible! Myself and a co-worker stopped by for lunch, after ordering we both asked for drinks (1 water w/ lemons and a fresh strawberry mango cooler). The waiter brought my water pretty fast; however, my co-wok on the other hand waited nearly 10 to 15mins for his drink. Our food came out about 20mins after ordering and was dropped off by someone other than our waitress. Now I'm no waitress expert but the least our waitress could've done was come to our table to see if everything was ok OR if we needed anything else! When I placing my order I asked for specifics to be excluded from my salad and I receive it with everything I DIDN'T ask for in it! After literally sitting there hoping and looking for our waiter (that by the way NEVER showed up since we ordered), I flagged down another waitress that looked like she didn't want to be bothered. Already irritated that our waiter is shitty and my food isn't prepared how I asked, I asked the waiter could my corrections be made to my salad. In the mist of this, I asked for an extra side of Ranch and tomato sauce for my pizza. When receiving the side of tomato sauce it was COLD! Why would you serve someone COLD tomato sauce if their intent was to add to their pizza?! If you're ok with spending your money at a restaurant and don't mind careless Customer Service from the employees, CPK in LBC is the place to go! I definitely WON'T be returning! And what makes it so bad is, they weren't even busy. It was literally my co-worker and I, and 4 other people, smh.

This place is directly adjacent to the long beach convention center and cannot handle large groups. We had a reservation for 20, are attending an event at the convention and 3 people still haven't received their meals including myself.  We've been here since 12:30.  It's nearly 2:20 and still no food.  Thank god my friend has left over pizza and the lady next to her had some left over pita bread.  A huge FAIL for this CPK.  You cannot be next to a convention center and be this disorganized.

But of a wait today.   Not busy. Dirty silverware.  Did they forget about us on the patio? Thanks for the bread.   Wait,  It's like 3 small nuggets.   Can we have more?   In the meantime we need more oil.  Brought bread 7 minutes later without oil.   Can we have oil & refill of water?   About 5 minutes later.... Nothing yet. I used to be a bigger fan of this place but I feel it's slowly falling away from its original charm.   A lot if the popular dishes have changed.  One of my favorite items are gone...brushes con checca.  I thought that was a mainstay. It's falling victim to being just another STANDARD franchise with overpriced menus.   Small appetizer plates & long waits.

This evening my wife had a problem with low blood sugar right outside this restaurant. They tried to help me right away. The paramedics had to be called. Alfonso, the manager, personally came out to make sure the restaurant could help. I was touched by his genuine concern. When the paramedics treated my wife and suggested she eat, we came inside CPK.  I have never been treated as good in a service establishment as I did at CPK. It was as if we had come home to eat at your mom's place. The food was excellent but the humanity was exceptional and extremely refreshing. The team at CPK turned a very stressful situation into an amazing experience rarely seen in today's world.

If you're in the downtown Long Beach area I would recommend going here. The staff is easy going, the food is precise, and they also validate your parking if you park in that garage nearby! Just don't forget to ask!
They have the new morrocon salad which is pretty good. It has nuts dates beets and yhe right amount of salad dressing. Why 4 star they keep forgetting to give me bread.
My husband & I tried CPK for the first time today! EXCELLENT customer service & DELICIOUS food!!!  we will definitely always come back

We tried to squeeze dinner in before the Laugh Factory and MY GOD the service was slow! It took a week to get our drink order and its not like it was very busy. Three years later, our starters. A millennium passes, our entrees. I'm not even exaggerating, it was a millennium - I am speaking to you from the future. (yes, they still have Yelp)  I wanted everything to go so smoothly for our visiting friends and man, I was stressed out. The food was fine but who could enjoy it as we're practically shoving it down and running for the door. Okay, maybe I'm exaggerating a smidge. :)

I don't usually review large chain restaurants, but I was at this CPK location twice (at the exact same table on the patio even) this weekend during the Long Beach Grand Prix. The entire road in front of it was blocked off with race cars going at high speeds, loud noises, maybe even some rowdy drunks yet the service was awesome, the food was really on point and the staff was extremely accommodating to those that wanted to sit on the patio (probably about 80% of people this past weekend); even saw some tables being picked up and moved and around just to make everyone comfortable.  I just want to thank this place for making my first LBGP experience more comfortable.

This was recommended by my dear friend Cj P who is a YELPER!  I am sitting here right now enjoying a wonderful appetizer and ice cold draft!  The manger is nAmed Alfonso and my server Casey is right on top of everything !  If you didn't take my friends advice to get over here, please consider this as a promise that you... You will receive excellent service and awesome food.

Restaurant wasn't busy yet good food took forever, even water took a long time(we had to ask). To order another cocktail took a long time. Our salads took a long time, a Cesar salad mind you. Then we were charged for 3 salads when we ordered 2. Then the manager had an attitude like we wanted free stuff, then he came back and tried to explain to us how we were wrong. When he realized we weren't wrong he apologized then said he would deduct the 2 salads for 6.99 off. Service wasn't good and either was the customer service from the manager Alonso. Fonso was apologetic but I was rather surprised at how the manager was.
Pear Gorgonzola Pizza and complimentary bread w/ herb & oil sauce.  It's all I ever order. XO

I've eaten at CPK before at different locations and enjoyed my experience there. However at this location I came for lunch maybe 20 minutes after they opened. The waiter for my table was very sarcastic and pretty much sloppy. He tossed the straws to each of us and almost slammed the glasses of waters to us. He wasn't mean or anything, but he probably had an off day? He cussed a bit and never checked up on our table at all, we had to call him over when we needed something.  The food itself: we got the Jambalaya and the BBQ Chicken with Applewood Smoked Bacon pizza which were both great.

I'm not really a fan of CPK, but my better half constantly drags me here... for salad (of all things). If you go somewhere and order the food that's not in their name, then there's a problem. CPK's pizzas are less than savory. Perhaps that's why they have a bounty of other things. Not my cup of tea.

I love CPKs food.  Unfortunately,  I haven't been to this location in a while, but it is in an excellent location close to lots of downtown attractions and in the Pike development that is being updated quite nicely.  Good place to eat when downtown.

Islands Restaurant across the street made us feel as if though we were an inconvenience for a party of 13,  so we decided to leave. Walked across the street to CPK, and we are SO HAPPY that we did! They welcomed us and made us feel like the valued customers that every restaurant should strive to do. Our waiter Mark, was on point, kept the drinks full and had a great sense of humor.  Great food, great company, great ambience, Excellent service! Great way to end the weekend. Thanks CPK! And kudos to Mark for his excellent service!

This CPK knows what they're doing! Le boyfriend and I stopped in for a dinner date. We both already have our favorites here, but decided to branch out. Our server Eric was great at helping us decide. We had: The Mediterranean plate - which was light and a good balanced small plate. The white corn guacamole w/chips - which was smooth and had a sweet kick due to the white corn. The white pizza (substitute the ricotta cheese with goat cheese instead) - salty, savory, and delicious all at once. The carnitas habanero pizza - orgasmic. Sweet and savory at the start with an explosion of heat and spicy following shortly after.  *Not for people not used to spicy food. The salsa will own you. Service was excellent. The place is clean and not stuffy.

I brought someone here that had never eaten at a CPK.  It seems impossible but it's true...that's why I was kinda disappointed in the food and service here.  It was a Wednesday night and it was pretty slow.  We ordered the avocado egg rolls and they were greasy and blah...which was a first for me.  The we split a Roasted Artichoke and Spinach pizza which I have gotten at several locations and I have loved!  Not here, it was burnt.  I usually like burnt pizza but not in this case because it made the artichoke crunchy...yuck! We didn't get refills on our drinks until we were finished eating...and that is a real pet peeve of mine.  I'm not sure if it was an off night but I like CPKs...I'm just not too sure about this location.

Good service, the waitress and manager regularly checked up on my party. I ordered the 5 cheese pizza, $10, and it was delicious but perhaps I shouldn't have indulged by myself. It was too much cheesy goodness for my stomach to handle. The tortilla soup ($5) was decent, not salty which is hard to find at restaurants. The flatbread ($6) with serrano pepper and sausage was good but for the price and size I suggest simply ordering a whole pizza. Don't forget to ask for parking validation if you used the parking structure. Overall had a good experience.

I came here last Thursday with my girlfriend for our date. They took our names and we waited 10 minutes. Furthermore, we waited another 10 minutes and I was glad that they notified us to wait patiently. (Most restaurants actually don't notify the customers.) We got called in and I believe a nice young man name Brian took our orders. Then, we waited for an hour for our orders. My girlfriend was frustrated. We came before a family that was seated and got their appetizers and dinner first than us. We ordered the Spinach Dip an hour ago, while this family that just arrived received their Spinach Dip and pizza 25 minutes after they just got seated. Our orders have finally arrived after an hour. Our waiter kindly took the Spinach Dip off of our check. I appreciated his understanding. I will be looking forward to coming back here with better service.

Although I'm usually a fan of CPK for quick comfort food or just a snack after shopping, this particular one was subpar.  For starters, the benches were wet when I was seated (obviously hastily cleaned.). The service was really slow, even though seating was fast. Even the beverages took forever to come out. Granted, there was a huge rush of cheerleaders and their families coming from a competition nearby at the time we ate. When the food finally arrived, it was not that great. Cobb salad (with beets), garlic chicken thin crust pizza, and the lettuce wraps. When I order thin crust I look forward to a crispy, potato chipy texture, not chewy and cold crust. The cheese tasted off as well. I didn't like the other items we ordered but I accredit that for my personal dislike for bleu cheese and mushrooms. The only redeeming quality of the food was the warm fresh bread served upon request.  However, the service was friendly though busy, which is why I gave this place two and not one stars.  Unfortunately, other CPKs I've been to have been much yummier :(

I like this place because of their outside dining area and the curb side pick-up! It's a great place to meet-up friends since it's at Pine Ave and when you're dining outside you can see the people coming and going right away. As for the food, I like the original chopped salad and the half order is plenty enough or the Jambalaya, a little bit spicy!
I ordered a half salad called Roasted Veggie with Shrimp and it cost $17!! It was not good at all. The only good thing was the shrimp. I definitely am not impressed.
Love this place...mmmmm there pasta is delicious... I can eat ( carbs) here anytime....lol
Worst service was seated and waited 15 minutes for a server and nothing a couple was seated in front of us and we're attended to quick WTF were we invisible so we left

Alfonso (the manager) and his staff were very attentive. They recommended a couple of dishes and they turned out to be amazing. The butter cake was something that 3 of the staff members had told us about and it did not disappoint.  Would come back here again.

Ordered the California Club pizza and The Works,it was delicious and they serve more than just pizza in case you want a salad or pasta. My boyfriend had a beer and I had a strawberry margarita, which was also good :p The customer service was what I really liked though, two thumbs up! I went in on July 4th around 6/7 pm.

I generally don't like chains anyway so I don't eat the airline quality food that conveyor belts like this pump out, but yesterday my preggy wifey was craving CPK, so I took her by for a takeout pickup...& waited in the car for almost 45 minutes while she was inside waiting for them to microwave her prefabricated meal & put it in a to go box. Bad form.

Tried to eat here Sunday night, March 27, but after 5 minutes of standing at the host podium while two people chatted and were unable to acknowledge our existence we went across the street to Islands, where we were at least able to get a seat.

Don't get me wrong, I love CPK - just not this location. My rating is mostly for service.  It was a total of 3 of us.   We arrived around 7:00 pm on a Saturday.  While the restaurant was a little busy, we didn't make a fuss and patiently waited for the 20 mins that we were told we would have to wait.  20, 30, and finally one hour went by.  I asked the host how much longer we were supposed to wait and she looked at me like a deer in front of headlights.  She looked at me like I was from another planet and then called her Manager - some Asian guy with BAD BAD BAD BAAAD breath.  He had no explanation and said we would be seated within 15 mins.  Ok, fine - we waited and finally sat.   When the food was delivered, it was clearly NOT close to being hot. By this time we were reaching famine status so we devoured our meals regardless of the temperature. Okay? And the waitress reminded us that she was done with her shift and if we wanted to pay as soon as we got our meals, please. We tipped but this was like a scene of Benny Hill.  Totally ridiculous and I laugh about it several months later but this colorful event made me not return to this CPK in question.

As far as CPK's go. This one is just as good. The wait was less than they said, the food was as good as I expected. The only problem was that the App didn't come out before the meal so we canceled it. The management went above and beyond to make up for it. Whenever that happens in a chair restaurant, I'm always impressed. Worth stopping in, staff is very friendly.

CPK seems to be one of those So cal staples I missed out on growing up in LA, so I don't know if there's something endearing to others that I'm missing out on this place? There's one across the street from my work but it's always really slow so it's not the top of anyone's lunch suggestion. However, I did find myself hankering a craving for some thin crust pizza. After NYC, it just hasn't been the same in the pizza world and so I thought- "Why not?" Add on the CPK giftcard my little cousin had bribed me with to take her to Hollywood, I was set for a free yummy meal, right?  I called in the order at lunch time and walked over to pick it up and take back. Walk time- 25 minutes tops. My Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza was completely cold...I guess if you want it hot, you'll just have to eat it there. I was a bit disappointed at the size of the pie. It was barely 75% of the box and the toppings looked sad and processed. The pineapples had a canned look and the chicken was a bit dry. Disappointing.  They charge an extra fee for converting regular pizzas to thin crust. Service was good and I had no problems with the phone order. But this was one pizza that just wasn't quite worth its $13.50 price. I think if I'm eating CPK, I'll stick with the Costco triple packs.
Food is great like always... BUT service took FOREVER at this location. It wasn't even crowded. I will not come to this location again, unless I get treated :)

We were staying near the convention center and decided to have dinner here.  Normally we have lunch here when we are in town.  The pizza is delicious everytime.  However this time we waited a whole for the bread to arrive and then the pizza came right out with it.  The pizza was slightly cold but we managed to eat it.
On our last visit, service was horribly slow. It took ten minutes to get water for the table, and we didn't get bread for about twenty. OMG!
I made reservations one week ago for a party of 8 for birthday celebration and when we arrived they informed us we would have to wait for a table. No indication of the wait time....
Good service and great food! Waiter suggested bacon on the chicken BBQ pizza, which made it that much better!

My husband and I visited this location for dinner last month to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The food was excellent and the service was as well.  Alfonso was the manager present at the restaurant this night...he was very warm and welcoming. He knows how to create an environment that causes the patrons to feel as if they are in his own home and not in a restaurant. Brian was our server. He was easy to talk with about every item we ordered...which were quite a few and he was prompt about bringing us everything that we requested. Most restaurants have the feeling of a business. This CPK location along with the one in Los Angeles on the corner of Figueroa and 7th are the two locations that we have visited recently and noticed that the employees created an environment that was so welcoming that we felt like we were walking into someone's dining room which made our dining experiences on these two occassions completely "wonderful"! "Again, thank you, Alfonso and Brian for making our anniversary dinner so memorable...we appreciated it more than we can say. We will see you again!"

Went for some apps and drinks with my boyfriend. We were seated right away and attended to by a friendly waiter. We ordered the crispy mac n cheese, the spinach artichoke dip, chicken dumplings, and two drinks. A different waiter came to tell us they were out of mac and cheese (but we weren't offered anything to substitute). We didn't wait long for our food, but had trouble flagging our waiter to ask for water. We ended up asking another waiter, but still had to wait until our check came to get water. Not good.
We always come down here to eat, but tonight we went to the bar, and Heather was serving. Extremely attentive and a superb bartender! My girlfriend and I had an amazing time!

Best food server I have ever had!!!! Food was great! Service, as I said was stellar! Tried the shrimp scampi fettuchini today, it was great! Also the tortilla spring roll combo was devoured! Our server, Casey, was the MOST POLITE, INTUITIVE, PLEASANT young man I have been served by in YEARS!! I just had a terrible One Star service exp. this AM, so this shows me it isn't the generation that is impolite and rude, just some people!

Was greeted from the very beginning by extremely friendly staff members. My waiter provided a recommendation which turned out to be excellent and I felt very welcome!  Great food, great service- I will definitely come again if I'm in the area!

We came here on a Thursday night and it was absolutely fantastic.  I'm actually really surprised to see that people complained about the service here.  It may have been because there were less people in the restaurant but overall I was really impressed with the staff.  The hostess opened the door for us on our way in and our way out, and immediately showed us to an ideal table.  Our waiter was consistently checking on us to make sure that everything was going well and the manager even came over to make sure we were having a good experience.  The food was yummy as always.  I thought the olive oil dip they provided for the fresh baguette roll was a really nice touch for the start of our meal.

I've been to cpk maybe four times ever nd each time I always ordered the spaghetti bolognese or the barbecue chicken salad but this time I ordered shrimp Alfredo, my honey ordered their pizza it was a pepperoni and bacon pizza, I'll never forget it because it was very tasty. I've never tried cpk's pizza before it was delicious. oh! and they make amazing drinks too

I was at this location a few days ago and had the worst CPK experience ever, due in whole to the snarky, ill-tempered manager Jason.  I will start with the positive, because--unlike Jason-- I'm not a moody sourpuss on an unwarranted power-trip.  Normally at CPK I get either the tequila lime fettuccine (with extraaaaa of that incredible creamy sauce) or the roasted veggie salad w/ salmon, however this day I craving something specific so I asked for my own customized pasta dish with a few ingredients to which the server (Slick Rick) and cooks obliged (and they did an impeccable job at that; I couldn't  leave a single noodle behind!). I will say that Rick was really friendly and accommodating-- he even brought me extra blueberries (twice) when he noticed my struggle to extract the blueberry from my [delicious but weak] sangria--which earned bonus points in my book. I mean who doesn't get super stoked when they're surprised with tiny blue balls, right? Since we weren't getting a buzz with our carafe, my girlfriend and I headed over to the bar to try our luck there. At the bar, we were pleased to meet the bartender, Casey, who whipped us up some wicked drinks with just the kick we were looking for; kudos to Casey for delivering on that front and MORE IMPORTANTLY for his friendly and upbeat demeanor.  So here's where things get iffy: my friends and I are at CPK for about an hour and a half having a lovely time when my homegirl and I leave to the car for a while and the 2 men left at our table start getting harassed to close out the bill cuz "Slick Rick" is getting off his shift. My buddy said he wasn't ready to close out, as they were still ordering beers (PLUS US LADIES HADNT HAD DESERT YET!!! Hello!! Women need chocolate!!) and apparently that wasn't cool by their standards (even though EVERY other place I go out to has no problem handing the table off to someone else and sorting the gratuity issues out with management---NOT in front of the customers OR forcing the customers out!) so they eventually called over the manager, Jason, who was acting like such a tool on a high horse, you'd think he was the CEO of CPK Corporate. Naturally, my friends were already pretty ticked by the time Jason came over to force us to close the tab out and it was provoked by Jason's attitude and unwillingness to let anyone speak, but Jason had no problem verbally sparring with the customers who's only complaint about the experience was that we weren't even close to being ready to leave. Jason was so rude that my buddy told him he'd make sure to write to corporate about this-- wellllll Jason must've been pooping bricks because after walking away with major attitude, he came back and gave us only minor snark (a huge improvement), and then told us he comped all the food and only charged us for the drinks. Talk about ridiculous--nobody was asking for anything free!! Literally all we wanted to do was stay longer and spend more money (I seriously wanted dessert and a couple more of Casey's awesome mixed drinks likely followed by more dessert!)  Anyway, we left and headed to Chili's where we drank for a couple more hours, got dessert, then ate again. FYI: Chili's policy for a server's shift ending is whoever puts the food on the table gets the tip---- AND they would never have anyone close out before they're finished eating (we asked---and the server at Chili's agreed that the whole sitch at CPK was incredibly tacky)!  Thank you to the exceptionally poor management for completely ruining what would have been a great CPK experience! I do visit CPK at least once every couple months and have never had any issues so I will be going to other CPK locations but I will definitely NEVER be back to this one!

The food is usually great but the service and food this trip was awful!  Rude server when we ordered and the wait time was ridiculous. Our food was served cold. I suggest better service if you want people to keep coming. Others around us were complaining about the same thing. Bad night at the CPK!

Came here for a quick bite before a show. I haven't been to a CPK in such a long time and now I remember why not. I guess it's because the pizzas are just not very good. Forget that there is 'pizza' in its name, forget that they specialize in pizza, and even when you do, you still can't understand why the pizza is so sub par. I think what I dislike most about CPK pizza is the crust..... or rather, the texture of it. The service was okay. The gal who was serving us was pretty attentive and on the ball, but even so, she wasn't able to make my pizza taste any better.

Went there on 9-14-14, Service was super slow and bad. I had to keep begging for a refill on lemonade and never bothered to refill water. We had 3 kids that ordered pizza and our food took well over 30 minutes to get especially my soup and salad.(Really, over 30 minutes for a wedge salad and a soup to pour into a bowl!) The restaurant wasn't even half full. Terrible! The manager just said, Thank you for telling us, without even offering to rectify our terrible service. Never going back. We should of just gone to PF Changs.
Food is bland and price doesn't reflect quality of food. Never coming again. Service wasn't so great either.

November 2015 marked our first trip from the East Coast to California. We stayed in Long Beach for three nights before boarding a cruise ship. On Friday we had lunch at CPK and liked it so much that we got take-out there Friday night. AND THEN on Saturday we dined in for dinner!  The food is excellent, but better than the food is the absolutely fantastic service! All staff members were very attentive!

I went here yesterday for my job's fundraiser. The food was good, it was just the service that made it bad. She was really difficult about things that could have been solved within matter of minutes. Apparently she was not notified about the fundraiser.  Today I just recently found out that she had over-charged our whole party more than 18% grad...just because she was not happy.

They were really slammed with a convention but our waiter Casey was really nice and explained to us it would be longer than normal.  The gluten free margarita pizza was awesome and worth the wait. The woman that dropped off our food Tina was very nice too even though they were busy.
I love this place. I had some problem here and there, however management knows me from my many frequent business and they're all very friendly.

I just want to take a moment to rave about the Morroccan Spiced Chicken salad.  It lives up to the description:  One of a kind, with roasted butternut squash, dates, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, chopped egg and cranberries. Tossed with housemade Champagne vinaigrette. Without question, one of a kind.  you get so many rich, complimentary  flavors in every bite.  I genuinely enjoyed this!  Aaron, I am sorry the person I dined with tipped you light...you deserved better, he just isn't a tipper :-/

CPK is a restaurant chain. Expect restaurant chain service and restaurant chain food. That being said, it's not a bad thing when it comes to CPK. They make pizzas and they're goooooooooooood. My lady typically orders the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and I typically order something with an excessive amount of meat.  I know, first world problem woes. Other than that, expect the average. Cheers!

The service started out great. Food was amazing once it came but after that we were forgotten about. The server walked by over and over and didn't ask if we needed anything else. Once we finally got the check the server never came back. After waiting 20 minutes I had to ask some random employee to cash me out. Absolutely horrible service at the end!

WOW. Impressive food, and service. Our server Brian was so great. He seriously timed our waiting periods. He was not supposed to be our server but he came and said that he was going to take us because we had been waiting for a little longer than a minute and hadn't been asked for drinks, he was knowledgeable about items and the menu and made great reccomendations! We loved the butter cake. Loved watching the way the staff interacts with eachother! They just seem so happy and work together bery well.
We ordered the usual kids pizza, Kung pao spaghetti, club pizza, and Waldorf salad. It all tasted okay. The server was great. 3 star for food and 4 star for our server.
