Great place, great food, and great service. We attended a bridal show at the Convention Center and were starved (no food at the event -- boo!) Luckily, CPK was just across the street. We were seated promptly, received our food immediately, and our server was on point with the refills. I don't love franchises very much -- but I appreciate CPK and their extensive fusion of menu. Awesome place if you're in the area.

I am in from out of town. I have eaten at CPK before but this review is mainly for the staff at this location.  I had gotten up to use the restroom and a few young girls in front of my were being harassed by a man near their table. After talking to the girls I was so upset with this man's comments I told the staff, they were extremely professional and understanding.  Then a few minutes later the manager came out and talked to the man. I was so pleased with the way they addressed the problem immediately without causing a scene. Then to top it off we received our food and drinks very fast for being so busy.  I am very happy with my visit. Thank you.
Always love CPK and love it more because my city no longer had one. Wait staff was friendly and food served fast. It's located in the most beautiful area, full of shopping and site seeing.

The service sucks. We had to ask for them to take our order after 10 min, and they didn't ask us what drinks we wanted. Our server dropped bread on the table and didn't provide us with new bread. The people next to us got they're appetizers right as they walked in.
Unique pizzas , a little expensive for pizza though. It was a fun experience but doubt will go back due to price.

CPK must be changing menu items cuz Mom n I gave our very handsome, friendly waiter, Casey, a test about what was different. We missed our old faves.  Casey handled us with that great pro smile and invited us back. Took me longer to get there then I wanted but Casey remembered me so all good.  Then the manager Alfonso comped our small plate and invited us back...again!  If Caseys working and I get a yummy small plate I will keep coming back.

Friendly staff and delicious food. Quite lovely ambiance. We had are friend's birthday dinner there and it was really cute. I had garlic cream fettuccine with mushrooms was more than enough for me but make sure to ask for extra cream on it.

I normally would want to go up a higher rating here because I love me some CPK!  I suppose a 3.5 is in order.  I've been going to various CPKs since college and have loved their food ever since.  Over the years, I've found them to be consistent across the board with service and food.  This night was to be an exception. It was late on a Friday night and the kids were across the street at a convention center.  I was ordering food to go prior to there closing.  Being a Friday night, it was busy in the restaurant right up until closing the doors at 10 PM. I had called in the order at 9:20, knowing they closed within the hour.  All went well with the ordering process even though it was loud on both ends of the phone.  I ordered a couple items that I hadn't had before, the quinoa and arugula salad and the spinach and asparagus spaghettini.  Ordered both with chicken.  The person I spoke with said it would be ready in 20 minutes.  I waited for a while then headed across the street.   I arrived at about 9:50 thinking they would have either given my food away to another customer because it was so late, but it looked like they were still seating customers walking in the door.  That was nice to see.  I waited at the front desk for a moment as the host was bringing other guests to their table.  He came back and asked if I needed anything.  I mentioned that I had a phone order and he directed me to the back counter.   I proceeded to the sign and register that I was directed to and waited for someone to come by.  Lots of people did, but no one offered to help me.  Guessing at least 10 staff passed by, but said nothing.  I can only assume they were busy, but it would have been nice to have been acknowledged for standing at a register for to go orders.  I then noticed one of the waiters who passed got the attention of another staff person.  Surely he was the guy overseeing the counter.  Sure enough, he was .  He came over to a woman who was eating at the counter next to the register and collected her bill with payment and returned to the other side of the counter to process her check/ payment.  So I continued to wait.  I saw staff carrying food from the kitchen and others with plates from floor to the bus station.  Others were simply walking back and forth along the counter with nothing in their hands.  Still nothing.     Finally, the same host who directed me to the counter walked passed.  My perplexed look probably told him that no one had helped me yet.  I inquired if anyone was working the register and he offered to grab my order.  He looked at the order line and found by ticket.  The only one hanging.  He looked down and found a couple of to go containers on the counter and told me he'd check to make sure the salad was being worked on.  He came back around and found what he was looking for right in front of the other container.  He started bagging up the items and told me he'd be right back with the waters and bread and butter I had ordered.  He then went around the counter to the other side and began talking with another member of the wait staff.  The talking began to look like joking around and more social chatting than anything.   Another waitress then came by and asked if I needed anything.  I mentioned that the other gentleman was going to get some waters, but looked like he was distracted. She smirked and agreed and said she would get them for me.  By this time, a manager came by and asked if I was being helped.  I mentioned I was being taken care of.  When the waitress returned with the waters I asked about the bread and butter and she immediately went to grab and bag them as well.  The host who initially helped me then walked by with a plate of food from the kitchen, grabbed a glass of water and proceeded to sit down for a meal.  Guess he was distracted with his own break time as well.  She returned and put the bag in front of me and said, "You're all set, have a good night".  I then mentioned that I hadn't been rung up or paid yet. She smiled and went around the register to ring up the order.  She thanked me for mentioning that.  I paid and went on my way.   The quality of the food was great as always.  I just wish the customer could have been more of a priority on this night.   Keep on Yelp'n!

Inattentive waiter is obviously over worked,  was sweating from running around so much and forgot simple things.  Food was nothing special.  We should have stayed home and ordered pizza.  Waste of time and money.

Please don't waste your time, money or ears (LOUD MUSIC) on going to eat here.  The food is low quality, not fresh and the restaurant is not clean.  Seriously, I complained to the manager and instead of immediately saying OF COURSE! Please let me make it right, he tried to say at least three times that CPK strictly portions their menu items so all are made the same and same size, and I thought well he must mean STINGY.  A few bits of bacon and half slice of turkey does not make a CLUB Sandwich.  Ridiculous.  I've given CPK about 5 chances in the last two years (because it's walking distance) No way!  Never again. NEVER!!!! Have learned my lesson.  Next time I want to throw money away, I'll save myself the trouble and throw it directly into the gutter.
I've had the best experience at this restaurant. The staff was very courteous and my waitress was so nice. To top it all off the food was delicious.

Love this place! Manager Alfonzo is a great guy who treats you special. One of my meals was a bit dry, one call and we had a whole new meal comped and tasted better than ever. I will continue to come here regularly! I recommend it!

Just walked into this place expecting to eat here. Walked out after one of the most uncomfortable and unpleasant experiences with the host! Yeah... The host! The host didn't acknowledge is as we walked in. He was on the phone and talking under his breath. He signaled us to come with him which we didn't catch as we thought he was still on his phone call. He told him he was rude first for the hand gestures and the pointing and secondly for not speaking. No apology out of him, instead he sat us down and put are menus on the table and walked away. Lol!!!!!! Omg... I realize this is a chain restaurant and I shouldn't expect anything amazing out of it but hey, there are about 20 restaurants within walking distance of a block from you, I'll go somewhere else!

Food decent. Service horrible. Arrived at 2pm on a Monday and still took almost ten minutes to get the tables ready - there could not have been more than 10 other people at this place when we got there. Even then, the table was still not ready - they did not pass out the silverware or the menus. The drinks took 15 minutes before it finally arrived and ordering took another 10 minutes. Here's where it gets worse. The food took an hour before arriving, and even then 2 of our orders were wrong and 3 of them were missing completely. When the orders were missing, they did not even apologize but simply said "it will be out shortly" (took another 15 minutes before arriving still). The pizza was cold when it arrived and simply disappointing. Also, while barely starting to eat, the servers would ask whether or not you wanted a box to pack your food. The food is reasonable, but the service is awful. There was so little other customers at this California Pizza Kitchen when we were there yet they could not handle such simple tasks. Waters do not take 15 minutes to gather. Definitely not a good place to go if you do not have two hours of time to wait for them. 2 stars for the food. 0 for the service.

While in Long Beach this past weekend, good friend Joy suggested Lunch at CPK near the Convention Center. We were seated at our Server greeted us but never returned to place our drink order. After 15 minutes, another waiter, busy himself with his own tables, came over and took our order. Our waitress took forever to return for our Lunch order. Seconds before she finally returned we were about to ask for the check, pay for drinks and go elsewhere...instead we ordered. I ordered the Spinach Artichoke Dip & chips and Joy ordered a specialty pizza. I ate every bit of my dip & chips. Joy didn't enjoy her lunch as much as I did. She mentioned that the crust was almost a bit under cooked & "doughy". That pretty much ruins a a pizza. Toppings were delish but she wasn't impressed. I didn't have my morning coffee so I ordered coffee. Their cups were so small that as soon as I finished a cup, it seemed forever until I had to wait for a refill. I was really looking forward to lunch here since it had been years since my last visit to a CPK in Phoenix. I hope my next experience at this restaurant goes better than this visit. Cheers***

The name fooled me, the menu is way more extensive than just pizza.  The drink menu is just as impressive.  Neither will disappoint.  The staff was friendly and engaging.  The chef even stopped by to make sure everything was good, which it was.  It's a nice looking place. I always enjoy watching the meals being prepared.

The place is really busy so the servers don't pay attention as much but I like this cpk better than the others because the name tags and the menus were unique.  Just a quick tip, the avocado egg rolls are really good but only 6 little pieces (cut in halfs so really three whole pieces) come out.

Slow, slow service, server brought out wrong drink, had to hunt someone down for sugar for my iced tea, had to ask for refills, food was not hot, wilted lettuce in my salad, and runny Mac and cheese.  Our server forgot our appetizer, forgot to apply my coupon to our bill, and didn't bring my sons ice water refills in new cups- she only rinsed out their old cups, which had chocolate milk and root beer in them.  She even switched the cups accidentally so my root beer kid got the cup that had chocolate milk in it (which still had chocolate syrup in it).  Maybe a Heath code violation.  Will not be returning.  A waste of $60.

Great food and great service!  First timers here! We ordered two 10-inch pizzas, the original pepperoni pizza and the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage, the Farmer's Market Soup, and the Ceaser Salad. Needless to say they were all delicious! I really enjoyed the food and the service.

4 stars because our server Travis totally kicks ass. He was busy but he never forgot about us. He have great service on  this busy mother's day...and we watched as a woman who just looked miserable with her husband n three small kids give him the hardest time...he kept smiling giving the great service. The food was great...portions enormous n delirious.  Thanx Travis you rock!

Ya know, I've always liked CPKs, but it's still a chain of course... They've recently stepped up their menu adding a little more gourmet and then some sort of pizza rewards club thing while still keeping all my favorites like the Moroccan chicken salad and butter cake.This particular CPK was walking distance for our hotel and we had some fantastic service, so I just HAD to give y'all 4 stars!
I ordered the Barbecue Chicken Salad. The Ranch dressing was sour.  And the chicken tasted like it had been sitting in the refridgerator for 3 days.  Overall,  the salad was NOT fresh.

Good Service, but I got sick! Service was excellent with friendly waiters, however my wife noticed the plates and utensil were not completely clean, they exchange them at our request and we got a new set, not quite clean but we let it go. We order two the works and California pizza for a party of three. After we finished and a small walk around the mall, I started feeling not so well, and unfortunately I ended up with diarrhea. I think was the California pizza with avocado with salad topping not well washed. I expected for a higher prize than around the block pizzeria should be more concern with hygiene issues. Because of this a Rate Service 5, Price 4, Hygiene 1.
Came in a Tuesday after noon (not  busy) awesome service by Roman and food was cooked to perfection and just the way I requested . So happy ! he also informed us about their deal with Cinemark ! Nice
Our favorite restaurant! Their is a wide variety in the menu.  Halibut is outstanding! Salads and pizza great as well as appetizers. Service is top notch. Ask for Brian - EXCELLENT service!!

Sat here for 15 mins and still didn't get any service.. Two of the server had eye contact with me but still didn't come up to my table to take my order.  It was 3:30 pm so lunch rush was over and there were only 3 or 4 tables dined in. I waited another 7 mins to see if anyone would come to my table but no one did. So I had to leave the restaurant with my family at 3:57 pm.  This place needs to rehire their server and work on their costumer service. I'm a server myself and experiencing this is extremely unacceptable.  I'm not the one to complain because I know how it is to work in the restaurant industry, but what I encountered today made me not ever want come back to this place.

2 stars due to service from the moment we walked in i wouldn't say it was bad in a form off bad attitudes but dull lacking in customer satisfaction.  The greeter (BRANDON) didn't  even greet us with a smile, " hey folks", " how yall doing", or nothing. He greeted us with the  " I hate this job face" (-_-)  followed by right this way. We get to the table and he places our sliver and menus and from of us and walked away. No wait the stopped and said ur welcome after we said thank you. But the poitn was je didn't leave by saying " your server is blah and he or she will be with you"...... sadly our serve (JOSH) was no better he rushed us while we ordered...then he gives us no napkins then we ask for some and he brongs us 3 Despite the bad customer service the fiid was amazing i would definitely come back again praying the their employees are having a better day or they simply called off

I'm very unhappy with the service our waiter was very short and rude he didn't look at us I was very clear to him that I didn't want cheese in my pizza and they brought me the pizza with cheese my daughter had to wait another 15 min to get her food we asked him three time to bring us bread he brought it when we were done with our food he made many mistakes but that's not why I'm upset we all make mistakes it's the fact that he was not apologetic and not once smiled he looked unhappy to serve is made us want to run and go also we never got refills will not comeback to this cpk again

Almost went to Islands for our team lunch but last minute decided CPK. We were seated immediately during lunch hours on a Friday. We were given warm, toasty bread with olive oil dip to munch on while waiting for our meals. There are lunch special deals on the weekdays.  Pizza + soup or salad combo for $10.95: Spinach & mushroom pizza with farmers market soup. Hardly any spinach on my pizza (about 3 pieces) and overly cheesy. The soup was the total opposite! Everything fresh you could find at a farmers market meddled into one delicious soup! Farmers market soup is worth a try. While dining, the fire alarm went on. For a big chain like CPK, it's scary there were no proper procedures and employees weren't trained on protocol. All customers just looked around and so did the employees! For all we know, there could have been a fire in the kitchen that could have been potentially dangerous to the customers yet nothing was done. - 1 star.
WOW, and I thought I didn't like CPK.  Very good! Chicken Milanese was great. Very tender and juicy no.  For desert, get the Butter Cake with ice cream,  WAY worth the calories!!

Seriously Amazing service and good food. My daughter is attending college in Long Beach so we have been spending a lot of time down here.  We wanted to have some CPK but my husband didn't want to. The host at the door, Brandon, coaxed my husband in the door, seated us, and came back to make recommendations several times.   My husband found an entrée he loved so now we get to keep coming back!
debut and farewell, food wasn't good, no pesto taste on my pesto penne, over cook pizza, hostess ridiculous diva attitude but servers OMG best servers ever!

I don't know what happened to this place it has totally gone down hill. Pasta seems like a hit or miss same goes with the service. Cpk is just not what it use to be & nobody seems to care. Now I see why it's always empty. :,(
I had the GF chicken pineapple pizza, Unfortunately i did not care too much for their pizza. The bbq sauce was overwhelming and took away from the rest of the ingredients.

Came into CPK the food was very good, love the new items on the menu! The salads are fresh and the pasta is delicious! Our server Leo made our dining experience 100% better! He was very helpful in helping us decide what to order! We had a great evening and really enjoy the food and service here! Will be back very soon
Annoying waiter, little too eager to please expect when you really needed him, no where to be seen. Wifi bars show full, still don't work.

I went in the other day for lunch and it was awesome. Krista was my server and provided quick welcoming and friendly service. I got a lunch pizza and a cup of the potato soup. I definitely recommend coming here the prices on their lunch specials are extremely reasonable. I will be back in the future because I work on Pine Avenue. Keep up the excellent work guys!
Be ready for the management to treat you horribly! I was trying to bring 14 people in and Jack and Chelsea were both jerks about it! So sad this location is crappy!!!!!!!!
Even when this place is busy Casey and the crew still provide top notch service. The food is great along with great service! More the reason to come back.

Service was a little slow but it was Valentine's Day so I guess they should get a pass haha . The food was great though. We were able to bring our dog to sit with us on the patio seating Which was a high plus for animal lovers like us. We ordered :  Split pea soup Spinach artichoke dip Lettuce wraps  Kung pao spaghetti  Tequila fettuccine And a Sicilian pizza  And have absolutely no complaints about the food

I ordered a salad to go for lunch and it took a hour to make a salad. I had a seat near the to go counter and watched as everyone else retrieved their orders and left the restaurant. If it takes a hour to make a salad, someone needs to be looking into the efficiency of the kitchen staff. Also, the individual taking the orders and handling the money spent most of his time at the food prep station. I pray he was not handling the food as well.  To pay 20 dollars for a salad that you have to wait 45 mins to a hour on is ridiculous! UNSATISFACTORY!

First time visit was horrible, went today with my girlfriend she ordered a Dr Pepper and i ordered a strawberry refresher along with a pepperoni pizza. Our server was Todd and he had forgotten what I ordered to drink, the food came first and another person had to get my drink. He mentioned he forgot about the drink thinking it was funny. Everyone had bread in the middle of their tables except us. Food was good but service was horrible
Bad bad bad! Slow unorganized and uninterested ... Don't go if you are in a hurry you will die waiting for service management wake up!

I have recently tried CPK on pine ave, long beach and I must say our server was really friendly and helpful ; he was smiling all the time. I love their food because its tasty but the only thing is that their food (italian) is unhealthy and not good for people who are trying to shed some lbs. They cant do anything about this so I am giving four stars for food and service. They dont have free parking though.
Came here for Veterans day. Amazing and friendly service from the hostess as well as our server Mark. Great food. The manager Alfonso came by and added to our amazong dining experience too.
Great service, tasty food, fun outdoor patio, great date location!

CPK is okay. I came here for my friend's birthday lunch on a Sunday afternoon. There were 15 people. I thought they did a good job at the most part but the wait staff is so slow. Once we were seated it took the waiter 30 minutes or more to get our drinks. There were only 3 alcoholic drinks ordered and the rest were water, soda, etc. Our waiter seemed to have disappeared for a while. I didn't even him walk by for the longest time. After a longer wait, he finally asked us for our food order. The food came out at a decent timing so I thought that was good. The food is what I expected, yummy crust with whatever toppings you decided. The birthday girl's jambalaya pasta had a good flavor but was way too salty. I shared a Original BBQ pizza and half order of Cobb salad which was delish.  I am relatively peeved that bread was not given to us while we waited. Is it because we had a big group that we don't deserve bread? I didn't mention it even though I saw other tables with 4 or less people have bread and butter. Not that our group wanted the extra carbs or calories but it would have been nice if it was present and we would have decided ourselves.  The host that worked during the lunch hour on 9/27/10 was very nice. She did a good job accommodating our big group and even offered to put my friend's flowers in water while we were seated. She gets an A+. Overall, I wouldn't go here if you have a big group because the wait staff would be so slow unless you bring a snack while waiting.

Expensive and pretty un-extraordinary tasting.  The Hawaiian pizza was pretty bland.  The Two saucy broads' Hawaiian pizza puts this one to shame and at a much better price.  CPK is overpriced mediocrity.

In the past I've not been a fan of CPK, though I've been to many work lunches at numerous branches.  They are a little too corporate and generic for me.  Their wine list is unimpressive and overpriced.  Their food, in general, is pretty generic.  I've always liked the field greens salad with pears, candied walnuts and Gorgonzola cheese.  I've always found their pastas to be too heavy.  But, until recently, I have not liked their pizza either because their normal crust is doughy and their yuppie pizzas are just not my thing.  But their new thin crust pizzas are quite nice.  They are lighter, due to the thin crispy crust.  I wish they had more thin crust options.  I've ordered to go or delivery from this location many times and they are fine.
Great location to eat when watching the Ling Beach Grand Prix. We sat on the patio and watched the race for an hour plus.

Alfonso,  the Manager, was more than apologetic when my steak wasn't medium rare as requested. (The potato fingerlings were very flavorful and amazingly complimented the "salad" it accompanied). When Randi, our completely attentive yet not overbearing server, found out about my steak, she immediately apologized and asked if I wanted another. Hating wasted food, I declined. Alfonso,  though,  wasn't going to take no for an answer. "Free dessert?" I just wanted to let them know for the next customer. I wasn't looking for anything free; and just because it wasn't exactly medium rare did NOT discount the MOUTH TINGLING FLAVOR. "Ok, 20% off you bill." Hhhh. Ok ok, I'll take the salted caramel and my wife will have the tiramisu. (Both HEAVENLY) btw, we shared the Chicken Dumpling appetizer which I heavily recommend. She had the petite wedge salad. All in all one of the BEST places for food, service, and location!

We were glad that we had stopped by. The service was great, we didn't have to ask for refills, the food was served promptly, Scott who was our server was really polite and very helpful. We were even offered our drinks to go. The only thing was that there was too much cabbage in the fish tacos, but that was a minor thing. Good Job! Much better than the Palm Springs location!
We had the Roasted Artichoke and Spinach Thin Crust Pizza and it was excellent. And the butter cake was a nice finish.

I'm a CPK fan, Have never been to a CPK and been dissapointed and this one is no exception. My friend and I went for a late lunch and the place was near empty so hey fast service. The waiter was cute and attentive and brought everything quickly and with a smile on his face. The food was deelish and hot, like it should be. We left stuffed and satisfied. A happy customer..

Yeah, its a chain... but that doesn't mean its bad, right? CPK still serves up yummy and interesting pizza combos. Sure you know what you are getting every time, but its still good, and you still eat the whole damn thing everytime. Sure you could save those last two pieces... but you don't want to carry them around all night, and its too good to waste... The Thai Pizza is pretty good... and the Buffalo Chicken Pizza is nice [first it was there, then they got rid of it... then it came back... along with the Pear and Gorgonzola... HUZZAH]!

Stopped in for a quick lunch during a trade show conference. It was post-lunch rush and we were seated immediately, A few other customers in the restaurant, so you would not think the service would be so slow. Service was indeed slow, and it seemed to take way too long for the salads we ordered to be served. The iced tea was great (nice and string just the way I like it) and the salad was excellent. It's a god thing we were not in a hurry.

I am a CPK fan and I juat have to say, this CPK in DT Long Beach is not so great on the service side. No one said hi when we walk in and the place was slow too that day.  The pasta was luk warm and are pizza was ok. I was here in Mid Feb and just going over my notes and I think going to CPK in other area of Long beach would be a much better experiance. Last, my water was never refiled unless I kept on asking... The staff needs retraing or something! They like to talk and gossip then doing thier job. This CPK I will never be back agian.

I picked the wrong pizza.  The place was decorated nicely.  Its a chain.  They had many pizzas on the menu that sound terrific.  I chose to stick with the classic sausage, pepperoni, and mushroom pizza.  It was good, not great.  Had thin crust.  I would return, but not for that pizza.
One of the places we always frequent! Food is consistently good. Don't forget to ask for the free bread! Also try the Mediterranean foccocia bread

Pizza again?  I can't seem to stay away from pizza these past two weeks. (And I still had one more pizza that I ate after CPK. That won't be in a review though, but I will say it was homemade and it was our final meal of 2008. A meatball and jalapeno white sauce pizza. Something a certain Denver CM and her boyfriend had on their first date. :D ) We got a gift card to CPK and instead of saving it for awhile so that we could get pizza out of our system, we realized that our lazy asses had not done any grocery shopping at our new place and so instead of dealing with the grocery store, we ordered something for pick up. Sheri got herself a salad... a cobb with applewood smoked bacon. What she usually orders. I on the other hand went with a pizza. And I am glad I did. After the last few places, I needed a good pizza. We placed our order and by the time we got dressed and drove the short distance to the place, our food was ready. We ate up a little time trying to find the curbside pick-up, as it's not labeled anywhere along the street and not at all on the metal roll up door where they want you to park, a minor inconvenience, one that I can overlook. I have had pizza from CPK on 2nd & PCH before, so I knew a little of what they had and instead of going with something I have tried before, I went with the White Pizza. For those who are not sure sure what that is, it's got spinach, garlic, parmesan and romano cheese, I went and added the suggested applewood smoked bacon to it and got the honey wheat crust too. It was the perfect pizza. Not the greatest, don't be confused by my use of the word perfect. It was simply the best possible choice that I could have made that night as it wiped the taste of those so so pizzas from my memory quickly. I was no longer left with the taste of unsatisfactory pizza in my mouth. I've had white pizza's before, but there was just something about this one. I wish their pizza's were a little bigger, because I wanted there to be leftovers for the next day, sadly there were none. I am going to have to continue to try their other pizza's, but for those times when I am undecided or simply want a pizza I KNOW I will enjoy, that is the pizza I will have as my default pizza.
This place is awesome  .   Alfonso is always on his game . The food was divine casey was rocking the drinks  and the service tonight!!!!!!

CPK has some interesting items on their menu. I used to really like the tandori chicken pizza, but they no longer have it. I like their veggie pizza with Japanese eggplant and their Asian chicken salad is pretty good. It's a lot of food, which is nice.

Great service at this location.  Located directly across the street from the Long Beach Convention Center in a rather empty shopping center.  Tried the new vegan asparagus soup, but I'm not so sure I liked it...it had a funny after taste. When I want familiar food and I am in the area, this is a great place to stop.

I use to love CPK but after a few visits I'm kind of wondering what happened?  Their portions are smaller and the quality is just not he same.  Plus some of my old time favorites are no longer available? I use to come here for my gourmet pizza fix because I don't feel guilty at the end of my meal.  I also was  looking forward to their Peach Ice Tea and sadly it wasn't as tasty as I remembered it.  I know the economy had a huge effect on the restuarant world but COME ON!  At least their signature salads are still good because if it wasn't they would have gotten 2 stars.  I'm going to give them another try in a few weeks and pray I can update this post with a better review.

Service was awesome. We got a young guy who was very friendly and quick. However, this place does not deserve to be called a pizza kitchen. Their pizza is just not good. We had the pizza with everything on it. It barely had cheese, the crust wasn't that great, and it was practically a thin crust. I was very disappointed. I expected a great pizza or at least one on the same level as Boston's across the street or BJ's (both of which I recommend rather than CPK). I talked to various friends about this and they agreed. I can't speak for their other food, but if you have pizza in your name you better make a good one! Besides that the bread with oil was yummy and a good starter.

CPK is located directly across the street from the LB Convention Center. You would think they would be able to handle large crowds. WRONG!! They were horrible!  I knew it would be busy and so I made a reservation 5 days before I was going to be there.  Our party arrived prior to our reservation time and we were told that because they were busy that they gave away our table! We were not even late! They did apologize and then seated us on the patio (which was fine. But we were not happy that they gave away our seat...what if there was nowhere available to seat us??) We then ordered drinks and appetizers. And waited for almost 10 minutes to get our drinks. The server took our food order and asked if we wanted bread while we waited for our food. We said yes and then waited. And waited. And waited. 20 minutes later and no bread, no appetizers, and no drink refills. HORRIBLE! Another 10 minutes later the server reappeared and offered drink refills and apologized that we still hadn't received anything. After another 30 minutes of waiting a couple of the meals and one appetizer came out. Another 10 minutes and a couple more plates came out. After being at the restaurant for over 1.5 hours we finally asked to speak to a manager. We had to go back into the convention across the street and 3 of the 9 people at our table still hadn't received their meal. The manager ended up comp-ing the 3 meals we didn't get (he had them boxed to-go) and then gave us 20% off our bill.  Needless to say, we were still furious! All the tables around us came after we did, got their food before us, and were able to leave and be back to the convention on time. We ended up missing one of the speakers while waiting forever for our food and the bill. I will NEVER go back to this CPK nor will any of the people with me. (And we attend a convention held in LB every year) That is 9 customers they have lost.  Time to hire a more efficient kitchen staff and a manager that knows how to handle a crowd.
Korean BBQ Steak Tacos are sooooooooooooooooooooooooo good....

Where do I start? I've eaten at numerous CPK's and all are fantastic - both the food and service. My favorite dish is the asparagus and spinach spaghetti with chicken - I've had it about 4 times. The restaurants have great branding and feel "homely" which is always a good thing. Service is always great, my cup is never empty for long and overall I love this place.
Friend "Lets go to California Pizza Kitchen!" Me "I hate chain restaurants!" FAMOUS LAST WORDS. CPK, you have my heart.....And my 200th review!

"Ice ice, baby Too cold, too cold!" By the time I came logged off the web site, I was drooling!  But I was not to be fooled.  I drooled on my computer before heading out to an establishment only to be disappointed by the actual food.  The pizzas looked so diverse and delicious.  My hankering was for a Bleunami from Islands but I've already Yelped that.  I ordered the Bleunami and a salad to go then walked over to CPK for a pizza to put on ice for later.  I was  delighted to see vodka when I walked into the joint.  Vodka and pizza.  Fucking genius!!    Alas, I was only here for take out, but I already  pegged it for a summer hangout with friends of all types.This place is like ice, too cold too cold.  (Cold: an urban expression for excellent)     Even my vegetarian peeps can roll with me here.  I did not have time to peruse the beer section, but if they have Asahi....I can drag Hana here!  There are many eateries in this generic box of downtown gentrification.  Oh, I'm not mad at them even though it is pretty much corporate slop.  But, for convenience sake...it's good that I don't have to travel to LA for the same experience. My life in a five mile, radius?  Cool.  I'm old and traveling cuts into my...um,  primp and play time.   I could not decide between  Tandoori Mango Chicken, The Works or a Southwest Chipotle.  In addition those avocado eggs roll thingys looked like they rock.  I ended up getting The Works  on honey wheat.  Later on that night, I put the pizza in the oven and it came out hot and cheesy.  It was pretty good for a late night snack with a Cid specialty salad.  My next quest is to see how the Tandoori Mango Chicken holds up on ice. I like this spot.  5 stars alone for my anticipated and multiple return trips.

I've been eating here for years...haven't we all?  But I would like to highlight 2 items that I think are under-ordered on the menu.   Tricolore Pizza Salad.  I think this just confuses people.  Is it a pizza?  Is it a salad?  Everyone I have been to CPK with has never had it before, but they do have food envy when I order it.  The crust is much thinner than the standard pizza crust and is topped with parmesan cheese before it's thrown into the brick oven.   Once baked, it is piled high with mixed greens nicely tossed in their Dijon vinaigrette, finished with large shavings of parm.  Chicken or shrimp can also be added for an extra charge.  If you like good bread and salad this is the way to go.   The Chicken Tequila Fettuccine.  Tequila lime jalapeno cream sauce with sauted peppers and red onions.  It's not spicy despite the mention of jalapeno.  Try it (unless you are lactose intolerant, and even if you are, take one of those pills cause it's really good).

I stopped in this location when I was in town on business. I miss CPK since we moved away from California and was looking forward to having my favorite BBQ chicken salad! As usual I enjoyed the salad but it wasn't the star of the evening. The highlight was the wonderful service I received! This location is surrounded by parking meters and I needed to get change to go feed the meter. When Jason (I think he was the manager on duty) found out I was going to go back out and feed the meter he insisted on doing it himself! He took my change, went 2 streets over, found my rental car and fed my meter! Excellent customer service! Not long after he came back inside I saw him do the same thing for another customer. That level of customer service is a rarity in today's world. Thank you, Jason.

Me and my boyfriend love CPK! We always get a BBQ chicken pizza and macaroni and cheese. The service at this location is always great, we really enjoy having "sara" as a server, and the managers and bus boys are always very attentive.  It's nice to dine at a place with reasonable prices and great service.

If I could give it no stars I would... First of all I used to love this place... I went out to dinner with my husband I ordered the jambalaya with a coke he ordered a pizza... We had our drinks and shortly after the food came... My husband was about to eat a slice of pizza when a roach comes crawling from under his pizza...wow we were so disgusted....we were trying to be discrete about it, we got our waitress attention she came to the table and saw the roach she took our plates... She went to her manager and told her there was a little bug on the food.. A LITTLE BUG!!!!!! first off it was a roach second it crawled out from under the pizza..the waitress had the nerve to ask if she could get us something else to Wich we replied no way that's nasty and we left ...they have us complimentary dinners but we gave them away. Never will I ever go there....

It's a haven.   Sometimes a chain restaurant can just be that. A safe place where you know what you want when the restaurant name pops in your head and you know it will be good and satisfying.   When peeps at in the office are just becoming a little toooo much like family.... I need an escape for a little sunshine to walk across the street and treat myself to lunch here.  I am a creature of habit and most often order a 1/2 BBQ Chix Salad or the Tostada Pizza. You can't go wrong w/ either. But today, I ordered the Waldorf salad and it was very good. It reminded me of a Cosi signature salad w/ the grapes in it.   Sunshine breaks are a good thing!

yikes! the line was out the door when i came here for lunch. probably due to the anime freaks, there for anime expo. (don't worry, I was one of them too) it was a 35 minute wait, everywhere else was just as crowded. so we end up waiting that long. I'm sure its not that bad, when the convention center is not full of goers.  once we got seated, i order the original BBQ chicken pizza and jambalaya! The best pizza Ive had in a very very long time. Too bad it's so small for its price. About $12. I almost could finish a whole pizza myself. It was that good! nothing spectacular about the noodles. i also order strawberry daiquiri. it lacks alcohol, needed more alcohol. but flavor was good!  the service was okay, she offer us bread and refill our drinks occasionally. overall the pizza rocks!

I love CPK but at this location I was so very disappointed. It wasn't very busy but it took over 30 mins to get our food and the soup came out with the entree rather than before. Everyone got their food but one of us and there was no explanation. The waiter said it would be out soon. When asking for the manager to explain where the lost salad was he said the order had never been placed and they were just starting it! He seemed clueless as to why we were upset that there was no communication about this and that we never would have know had we not asked for a manager. He eventually said they would take the cost off the bill. We told him to just forget the order rather than wait and have one person eat alone. The waiter later came to apologize and tried to have us order a dessert on them. It was a very annoying experience leaving us with a sense that no one really cared. So much for celebrating a birthday together.
The food is always great!! I love the chicken picatta and will always taste great! Service sometimes is not the best, but CPK food is jusst awesome.

i love cpk but it seems that this location just is subpar...the service is always bad the 3 times ive been here and it seems to have a certain "funk" smell to it when you get in... this time it took long to get our food and we even came before the lunch hour...we thought we did that on purpose to avoid another long lunch break...3 of us go...we order 2 Chicken Tequila Lime Fettuccine...why did it take nearly 30 minutes to get it? i just dont understand...if you have a love for CPK dont come to this location or it might turn you off...good thing they still make great food...
Good service and good consistent food at all CPK locations. Portions have gotten small, though. But, I still come back for a salad, pasta or a pizza sometime.

not very good pizza!  came yesterday and mind you i havent been to a "cpk" in aeons!  so, since i was on lunch break from jury duty thought id trot down yonder and eat some pixxa!  bad idea! first we order a diet coke and a lemonade, diet coke comes its a diet pepsi BARFOLA!!  and the lemonade had nasty stuff dried on the inside of the glass so we kindly asked our server (who was nice enough) for a clean glass. we ordered the 5 chee and tomato pizza and a full caesar.  open my napkin rolled silverware and BOTH forks had crusty dried lettuce!  really?  so, i grabbed another set and made sure to clean it with my napkin.  salad wasnt bad the parmesan was very bland and the salad was a bit over dressed.  then the pizza comes and it looked thoroughly UNDER cooked. took a bite and although it wasn't unedible it was very well not very good.   then again what do i expect from these chain places?

Love CPK. But this location loses points because of their awful, awful service!! Randi was our server's name. At first she was sweet; I believe that it was because she knew she would be getting a pretty decent tip, we were a party of 11. She forgot our water & rolled her eyes when we asked for bread!!! It sux that this is such a convienient location for other entertainment, because the service is soooo crappy :( Go to the one down the road on 2nd street
Love their "Meat Cravers" Personal Pizza and their BBQ Chicken Salad...
Lani was so fun and helpful, I had to ask for her name! Great restaurant with a clean and friendly environment. Try the Cali Club. Super good!
Pasta chef Meltzer is great! He always makes its so goooood. We only come to this location :)

CPK has always been and most likely will always be one of my favorite spots and I am a little surprised that I have yet to do a review for them.   Been going for many years to various locations throughout SoCal and the quality, flavor, freshness, delicious food is great 100% of the time...and service, friendliness, promptness, efficiency is quality 90% of the time at most locations.  At this particular spot, service has been great! I love their salads, pizza and pasta...The original chopped salad is amazing and I love the dressing which comes with it - I could eat this salad every day and never grow tired of it.  I always get thin crust pizza's and they are equally tasty (no matter which one I get but my favorite is the pepperoni - I am pretty much a creature of habit but I have tried the bque chicken, the thai chicken and the artichoke/spinach and honestly they are all quite delicious).   Pizza is one of those menu items which is very personal and subjective and imost likely if you come from NY, you just may not find our Cali pizza to be to your quite biased liking (I am from Cali but have eaten plenty of NY pizza, which I love as well) but in no way does it diminish CPK pizza - apples and oranges really.  However, both are equally savory in their own unique ways. Their pasta dishes are delicious and filling.  While admittedly not authentic Italian to some - they are pretty close to the mark and you will not be dissapointed with all the unique, flavorful, pasta delights they offer.

Came here the evening after Valentines. They still had their special but wasn't interested in it. My tostada pizza was super soggy in the center, only the crust was crispy. My boyfriend really liked his chipotle chicken pizza though. This location was pretty mediocre. Not even the pen worked. I like the PCH location much better and the service there was spectacular.

The great service here is a highlight.  Most of the servers here are on top of things and tend to their customers well.   The pizza here is amazing!  The pastas are quite delicious as well.  As for the atmosphere, it is quite casual, relaxing, and a good place for a casual dinner.

I do like CPK a lot but the service at this one is sub par. food is slow to arrive and service has been less than stellar. such a shame because the restaurant really sells itself which is why the downtown long beach location stays in business

Pros:  Right across from the convention center.  Typical CPK quality. Cons:  Service is worse than other chain branches.  Didn't expect that even though it wasn't busy.  If I had a choice between this branch and another one farther away, I would choose the other branch.

I had the worst experience today at CPK. I arrived at 2:30 and was seated promptly. Me and my children ordered our food and waited.. and waited..and waited. Finally, our server comes out and says that someone came in and ordered the SAME EXACT MEALS that me and my family ordered and someone "accidentally" gave it to them. She offered to bring us something "on the house" to smooth it out, and I told her I would like another sangria. She also said that the manager would be coming out to speak with me. She left and never came back. 230 turned into 345 and still nothing. Finally I was fed up and we decided to leave. I got up and told one of the greeters that I wanted go pay my bill. He came back with a 60.00 bill.The manager looked at us and never attempted to come up to us and fix things. So I told him to go get the manager even though he was standing there the whole time watching everything transpire. When the manager came I told him that not only was the service horrible, but he was trash for not coming to address the situation and make things better. I WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN

Usually I only go to the Torrance location but since I was in the area with one of my kids (whose favorite restaurant is CPK) I had to give it a try.  The inside appears a lot smaller than the torrance location but they do have quite a bit of outside seating which is nice.  The service here was prompt, professional and with a smile.  All of our food came out exactly how we ordered it and our drinks were always filled timely.  I actually prefer this location to the Torrance one now just because the Torrance store's service can be a little hit or miss.

Yes, it's a chain.  Big deal.  I completely reject the previous comment about "Who knows where your ingredients come from."  When we arrived with Allergy-boy in tow, they produced a huge book with every dish and every ingredient listed.  They were extremely accommodating, and everyone took our concerns seriously, with the kitchen manager serving us personally.  Superb service, and a special shout-out to Rose, Tyler, and Alfonso.   And btw, the food is pretty good.  Allergy-boy had a cheeseless pizza, the Wife had fusilli with sun-dried tomatoes, and blondie-girl had a special order alfredo garlic pasta.  In other words, it's not all pre-packaged, they actually cook it there.  Well done.

When California Pizza Kitchen first opened years ago., it was great to experience all these different types of toppings, but now a lot of other places do the same thing.  What's happened to pizza is kind of like what's happened to sushi.  Most places that serve pizza will offer a variety of types.   The pizza at CPK (across the board, all locations) is good, as is the Asian salad.  The reasons to come here are the location (at the Pike, across the street from the convention center), and the amount of variety in their pizza selection.  However, their prices are higher than what the quality would warrant, and if you go on a weekend dinnertime, the wait is also a little too long for what the quality would warrant.

How have I not written a review for LBC CPK? Weird. Every time I am here for work, which is usually in January, we also have CPK at least once.  I love that they now have a small little tapas menu so that if you want something but not alot of it, bam order from that menu. I have yet to order a pizza from CPK, It is usually a salad of some sort or some soup. Maybe next year I will take the plunge and actually order a pizza lol.

I've lived in Long Beach for a long-ass time and if Sahar hadn't invited me out for celebratory cocktails, I may not have known that this CPK even existed.  Sahar's lure?  An intriguing PM raving about the awesomeness of one of their signature drinks, the Aussie Splash. We sat at the bar at around prime dinner hour and a couple other fellow Yelper goddesses joined us, but the restaurant wasn't that busy.  Our bartender, Daniella, waited on us hand and foot but I think it was because our cover was blown as foodies, *cough*, Sahar!  Or it could have been that because the place wasn't busy that she was actually giving us genuine service. The first thing we ordered from Daniella were the Aussie Splashes, a concoction of Shiraz, mango syrup, Malibu, and some other stuff that made this drink taste like a Dreamsicle garnished with 3 frozen grapes.  It was yummylicious.  We then ordered the hummus and the appetizer rolls which came in "Baja", "Mediterranean", and "Thai" flavors.  I pretty much liked them all. Strangely enough, the best things at CPK that I love are the Thai-inspired items, like the Thai roll, Thai pizza, and Thai pasta.  I also ordered the Sedona Tortilla soup, and although I like the flavors, the pureed texture always weirds me out at the first sip. Anyway, it's nice to know that this location is at the Pike, but it sits amongst many other restaurants that I'd rather venture to.  But if I'm around here again, I will definitely stop in for another Aussie Splash.  Thanks, Sahar.

At a recent trade show in Long Beach, for 3 straight days, I stood on my feet, made balloons, and talked for over 8 years continuously. And no, I am not part of the circus. My days consisted of long grueling hours of pimping (or promoting) the product by grabbing attractive women, small cute children, or attractive women with small cute children, taking their picture, printing that picture on a balloon, and then making a balloon for them walk around the show with. Essentially, I was the creepy balloon guy. Sometimes, I would get a bathroom break, but I never had the opportunity to eat lunch and would lead to 8 or more hours without eating. So on the last day when I was ready to eat my own arm off, I realized I was better off going across to the street to California Pizza Kitchen, since my arms have barely any meat on them. So I crossed the street, ordered three pizzas from here, and managed to eat nearly 2 of them on the taxi cab on the way to the airport. The rest I shared with my coworkers who were amazed that I could eat so my food and not be "under the influence" of something. "You should see me when I am under the influence," I said as I shoved a another BBQ chicken slice in my mouth. Anyway, the service was excellent here. My order was taken by a polite gentlemen who neatly packed my order into a "to go" bag. Of three pizzas I ordered, one was excellent (BBQ chicken), one was okay (The Works), and one could have been better (The Club). All in all, it was one of the better meals I have ever enjoyed in a cab. Who knew I could eat the equivalent of 2 CPK pizzas in 15 minutes? Burp.

Dinner was good but no exceptional. Service was lacking and it seemed like they really had trouble coping with a slight dinner rush. Food was brought to us almost cold and drink refills and other simple requests took longer than they should have.

CPK...where do I start?  You're a major corporation-feely-chain restaurant (Boo!)  Who knows where your ingredients come from :-/   The decor is so outdated and ::yawn:: boring! Your location...so touristy and convenient (for out-of towners, that is and convention center victims) But hey, they have an outdoor patio, a few of my favorite salads and a couple awesome pizzas. OK. The food, same as every other CPK, so you know what you like already, right? Not the place to try something new and exotic I suppose. The service? Great! They kept the beverages more than half full and were happy to move chairs, tables and adjust heat lamps as necessary for us (and promptly!).  The waiter was less than thrilled we had a few menu related questions... so that part wasn't too impressive. But I'm never truly phased by less than knowledgeable waiters at large corporate chainy restaurants. The patio. Well definitely NOT the place for you and Fido to enjoy a meal together, unless you like watching Fido from a raised patio while he sits staring at you (if he can even see you) from an awkward sidewalk area. You'll be separated, also, by a fence.   We were asked if our dog was a service dog though, this was one of the few times I felt like lying...That could be considered a type of white lie, couldn't it? Maybe not. So if you must eat CPK there's no harm in taking it to go. But keep in mind there are other LB local restaurants with great pizza, better salads, and patios that are actually service and non service dog welcoming.

We made a reservation knowing that the restaurant would be crowded during a lunch break while attending a conference at the Convention Center across the street.  We were seated quickly (8 of us).  Our server took our order in decent time.  And then, we waited, and waited, and waited .... a total of 1 hour and 15 minutes - no food.   Management was poorly prepared for a full occupancy with a sufficient kitchen staff.   We were not the only ones that had to take our lunch packed to go after waiting that long and eat during the afternoon session.   I would never recommend CPK at this location for anyone with a time constraint.  The management should have known that almost 1000 people were attending conference across the street and should have been prepared for a full house.  They had a sign welcoming the attendees at the front door - how could they be so unprepared?   Our server was gracious and we made sure he received an appropriate gratuity.  Management finally agreed to discount our bill - but that is not an excuse for poor planning.

Wow, the menu at CPK has certainly changed.  I liked it before, but it has definitely upped the ante on taste.  Gone are some of the old favorites, but there are a lot of "new" things to try.  Then again, it's been a while since I've been to CPK and gotten something other than my standby pizzas, so perhaps the new menu's really old.  They do have a handful of small plate menu items, which I know for sure are new.  Looks promising! In any case, the Moroccan-Spiced Chicken salad was a fresh mix of textures and flavors, with dates, cranberries, golden and red beets roasted to subtly sweet perfection (I love beets, so I'm biased here), toasted almonds, and nicely spiced chicken.  I'd recommend it for anyone who likes Mediterranean flavors and textures, with a bit of sweet and tart and crunch.  The Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizza surprisingly had a nice kick to it, not being overly spicy but having just a bit of heat to warm up the palate.  Usually, spicy at American-style food places means nothing, but this pizza carried its own.  My mom really liked the half and half Two in a Bowl soup option, with the Sedona Tortilla Soup on one side, with the Dakota Smashed Pea and Barley Soup on the other.  My brother got the Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp, and I could see him tearing up from the spice of the Thai red chili peppers they use in the sauce.  All in all, the food was great, and my family had a good, quick meal, with something for everyone. On top of that, this CPK was fast, convenient, and had great service!  Our server, Devin, was all smiles, and he checked on us regularly throughout the meal.  We never had to ask for water or refills of drinks.  He was always at the ready.  The rest of the staff who brought our food and cleared our table was excellent too.  After going to other CPK locations where I've had really bad service, it was really pleasant to eat at this location and have great service.  Quick, but without making us feel rushed.  Smiles and courtesy. This CPK is at The Pike, located across the street from the Long Beach Convention Center.  It wasn't busy at all when we got there (~6pm), since I'm guessing there's more of a late-night crowd here, given the clubs and bars in the area.  There's metered street parking at The Pike, but some are only 24 minutes spots.  We parked at a 2 hour meter directly outside of CPK (on the other side of the lane).  Bring your quarters if you plan on parking at the meters!  They're old school meters, at $1/hour.

If you are trapped at the Long Beach Conference center, don't eat here!   The food was very poor and the service was mostly absent.  We watched several tables around us receive their food before us, even though they arrived after us.   I ordered their BBQ Chopped Salad. It was full of large pieces of white romaine lettuce. There were 3-4 pieces of green leaves. I think this location's proximity to traveling customers may explain why it is still in business.   I doubt there are many return customers.

While at the Agenda trade show, we wanted to go somewhere close to eat. CPK was the place! 2 times! I had the chopped italian salad once. I can't say that it was anything special but not bad for a chain. Then, I had the BBQ chicken pizza. It was just like I remembered it- and it had been a LONG time since I had one. It's not the greatest pizza but it IS good!
Food was good! But service was better ass always. Every time I come here I always have s great experience . Casey our server was the best! Very attentive!

NO NO NO & NO!! Horrible place, I will never recommend anyone to eat here, nor will I return for a second chance.  Where do I even start here?! This place was horrible. My boyfriend and I came here for a dinner. Wasn't too busy, a few tables were empty. We waited 20 minutes for a table.. Not too bad. We were seated next to where the cash registers were, so we basically had the waiters and waitresses hovering over us while we tried to eat and have a private conversation. Appetizer took 25 minutes after she took our order. A couple next to us complained about not receiving their appetizer (they had ordered the same one!!! AND they had been seated before us!!) After we finished that, the entrees took about another 35 minutes to get to us- but ONLY cause I asked our waitress "how much longer until we get our food?" Guess what? The food was probably ready a long time ago---had I not asked, we probably would've waited a lot longer. The food was horrible. My bf ordered a sausage pizza - it came as a half burnt piece of dry cardboard with what seemed like 10 pounds of damn oregano on top. DISGUSTING. Almost sent it back but we had already waited too long for our food and were starving. He made it barely edible with some of their cheap ranch.  I ordered the kung pao spaghetti. It tasted ok, but was extremely greasy. Weird. I needed water to drink the entire time and not ONCE did our waitress come around to ask how we did. Zero tip. Horrible place, will never come back.  We ended up taking the red velvet cake dessert to go. Guess what? It literally tasted like white bar soap. WTF?! So much for looking forward to this place. NEVER. AGAIN.

I have always been a fan of CPK but I was really disappointed today. I usually get the Thai chicken salad, it was so bland. The slaw or cabbage tasted dry or freeze dried. The peas had an odd taste, but I continued to eat them. My wife just couldn't. She felt they had a funky smell. We told the waitress and nothing, not even an apology. We weren't looking for a discount just for them not to serve those nasty green things again.

The is review is simply for the take out section of the restaurant.  At this time there was a science teacher convention so there was a high volume of patrons.  Probably more than usual.  However, better management and understanding of the location and who they serve could've prevailed.  And it's not any better when you eat at the restaurant either. I had to pick up my order at 12:10. I got there at 12:30.  Stood in line.  Then found out that the people in front of me have been waiting for their food that was supposed to be ready at 12:00 PM.  WHAT?  I waited for about 45 additional minutes for my food.   (Why didn't I leave?  it was a patience exercise for me that day.) Long story short:  they only have ONE cash register and apparently the register between that one and the rest of the restaurant do not "speak" to one another.  So I could not pay for my food and just pick up at another register (and my food was ready - I know because 45 minutes later he took it out of the warmer from below the counter).  People who have not ordered and people who have ordered all wait in one same line. And at the restaurant:  Two ladies waited almost 30 minutes for their soup.  I thought they were at the end of their meal.  But nope, they were just beginning.  Yikes! Advice to people who work in that area during conferences: Bring your own lunch.   Advice to those who attend the conference:  Well.......patience is a virtue. Food was good though. :)

Note: Weekday dining arrive before 1150am or after 100pm for lunch. This location gets packed with the lunch crowds. Service good, food great, company even better. Yes..CPKs is your chain pizza joint. I never had a bad experience with any location. This LB location is in a nice area and has plenty of tables inside and out.  (Hot waitresses)....see Hamayun N's review. LOL.  If you order out, they'll deliver on their trust CPK bikes too.

After a long day at work we decided to go to CPK on Pine Ave.. Once we were seated on the patio i found a dead bug with dried blood inside the actual menu, yes dried blood!!!! That should of been a hint for us to walk away but instead waited for over 30 more minutes without a server or even a busboy offering us water. Finally got up and asked to speak to the manager once i told him about the bad service and dried bug with blood he apologized to me and got another server to take our order. Dinner was delivered to us by manager and server. We ordered the Grilled chicken, Tequila pasta, and pizza that was actually OK !  The manager once again came to our table and apologized about that bad service and dead bug with dried blood on menu. He said he will be  taking off the two drinks from the bill. Really after waiting 30 minutes findind a dead bug with blood???? Good luck but we will never ever go back to CPK again.....

I've had just okay experiences coming here. I work very close to this location so I usually come here during lunch. The food is always great! The parking situation sucks though. They have a parking structure but it's a bit of a walk. You can get it validated. There is also meter parking but there's usually never any open spots. The last time I came here the service was pretty slow to be honest. Our food took awhile to come. I'd say a good half hour. Also when they brought our food they got our order wrong so we ended up having to wait longer. It took quite awhile also for them to bring back the check and to box our food. Coming here on your lunch is not ideal since the service is pretty slow. I probably won't be back here for lunch. I probably will still order takeout though since I enjoy the actual food.

Horrible service, wasn't busy, got seated right away. Didn't order anything complicated. Ordered pizza and soup but still waited over 30mins before we saw any bread. And the bread was a mere 4 pieces for each of us. We had to ask for seconds cuz our food was STILL not here.  Then she started to try to make small talk as our stomach was loudly rumbling.  When I asked when the food will be here, she just casually said" oh, I will check for you". Like we haven't waited that long. I will never come back here again and believe you me, I will tell my Friends about the horrible service. If I had an option to do negative stars I would .

Horrible experience. Never again. Ill Try to make this short. Phone ordered a curb side pick up.  Gluten free crust, oil and garlic sauce, no cheese, mushrooms, artichoke hearts and red onions only. Then 1 garden salad, NO CHEESE, NO DRESSING.  Got to curbside location 5 mins prior to time quoted.  Curbside spot is taken by someone who clearly parked there, and left to go elsewhere. Great ill call in and circle around and hopefully they move, they never did. Called and let the gal know, asked her were I should park so they can make it out to me, she told me to park in the bus. Sounds like a horrible idea.  So I tried to weasel my way into the drive way area, in front of the bus zone so I wasn't run over by the next bus. But after 15 mins no one comes out with my food. I call in and she tells me "sorry we are just really busy right now, I'll tell them again". Great. Another 15 goes by. REALLY ?! I call again, this is my 3rd call and I am pretty much over it. She said she would send someone right out. 10 mins and a gal comes out, has a receipt for a total only, no itemized listing and its 33.00. EXCUSE ME? 1 pizza and 1 salad, I question her and she says she doesn't know what I ordered, this is just the receipt I have to sign and she needs to swipe my card. Whatever, swipe away I'll pay if I can just get out of the bus zone(because about 6 buses have nearly run me over in the past 40 mins), and go home and eat. Sign away and I'm off.  When I get home I pull out the salad, it is small, and it has cheese on it. WASTE. Then I open the pizza, it is no longer warm, there are no artichokes, and no onions. Just, count them, 15 mushroom slices, on crust, that's it. NOTHING ELSE. No olive oil, not the rest of my toppings. Just some sad mushrooms slices on some cold crust. So I pick up a piece and I realize something is wrong. I cannot physically break the crust. Not with my hands, so I slam it on my table, nothing. Everything I pay for is a WASTE. I take pictures of it all. I call and ask for the manager and I am told "he is very busy tonight I don't think he can speak to you, please give me your number"  Next day no phone call, so I call them. Tell that manager my sad story and he refunds me the entire bill. Thank goodness. the 1 star is for the refund. Never again.
Just because we're dressed up for comic con & look like weirdos doesn't mean you should treat us like shit.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would, my husband and I live down the street from the pike we never really go because parking is always a pain in the butt for us but tonight we figured what the heck we decided to grab dinner here around like 7:30ish we get there we get seated our server Antonia I think her name was asked what we would like to drink I said water my husband said "I'll hol......" yeah my husband didn't even get to finish speaking because she took off like a bullet n left I was like okay it's dinner rush I've worked in a restaurant before so I know how busy it can get as the time went on our server didn't speak to us!!! I watched her very closely and she was so attentive to every other table she had but my husband and I!! I became more and more annoyed by her everything I asked for it was like as if it was a big bother to her like I said before this lady did not speak I think the whole time we were there I heard her speak to us maybe a total of 3 times! Everytime she came up to the table she just stood there for a second or 2 and then walked away if I asked for something I got a head nod when I asked for the bill is when I got the most response from her!! This was the worst experience ever! And I really hope CPK revises and really pays attention to who they hire from now on because I'm pretty sure there are plenty of people in Long Beach who need a job and who would be a lot more professional about it then this! I don't know if my husband and I look mean or if we said something to upset the girl or if it's because my husband is Asian and I'm Mexican but I have never felt so uncomfortable before even talking to the manager when we complained about it to her he was so quick to rush me off the phone and he wanted my address to send me coupons! Now maybe this is me being paranoid but I didn't not feel comfortable at all giving my address out after telling him about what a horrible experience we had there let me be clear though I WASNT COMPLAINING ABOUT IT TO RECEIVE A FREE MEAL OR COUPON I JUST HAD SUCH A HORRIBLE TIME THERE I DIDNT WANT ANYONE ELSE TO FEEL WHAT I FELT.

My sister had never been here and i was in the mood for a good salad so we stopped in. We sat out on the outdoor patio since the weather was real nice. Our waiter Tyler come over right away to take a drink order. He was so nice and had a bit of a sense of humor. He was very personable and courteous the entire time.  I think CPK has some of the best salads for great prices, i usually order a half portion which is still a great size (see my photo) I like the option of having half and full size portions. The bread was soooo good, baked to perfection and man that damn dipping oil...mmmmm good. I believe its pesto and garlic that's at the bottom of the oil...its so delicious, we couldn't stop eating it. I ordered the Chinese chicken salad, my sis ordered the Jambalaya and my friend ordered the Alfredo with chicken All 3 dishes were very good. My salad was fresh, not soggy or over dressed with dressing. My sisters jambalaya was excellent. It was spicy but very tasty, not over powering to the point where you couldn't enjoy it. If you want pasta with a kick then order this. The Alfredo was good too, not to dry but nice and creamy.  For desert i ordered the chocolate cake with ice cream. it was cool. The presentation was a bit sloppy i guess cause the ice cream had melted a bit before it came to the table, but i still ate most of it. The cake was good, brownie like, nice and moist. it was a great dining experience overall, i love this location and will return. TIP: They offer 2 hour validation if you park in the pike parking garage

I've been going to CPKs for years now and i'm so happy they're still around.  The menu's always been great, they switch things up periodically and i've enjoyed pretty much everything. After the Tour of Long Beach bike ride me, my boyfriend and BFF went to CPKs at Pine Street for a late lunch early din din.. I had the BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad, half order and it hit the spot.  Just the right amount of bbq sauce, housemade herb ranch, scallions and cilantro, lettuce, chicken, corn, beans.. just love this salad and it was filling.   Always will come back..
Food is BLAH. Waiter got all our orders wrong. Staff spilling stuff everywhere. Horrible experience.  Should have gone to Island's. Definitely not coming back.

This place sucks. Waiter was in a pissy mood and dropped my wife's pizza onto the table. Scooped it back up and walked back through the kitchen, where we saw him literally just plop the pizza back on the plate and come back around. Garbage staff, lazy, & rude. Drinks are overpriced and bland.
Great service, yummy food & a great price!  The salads are fresh & tasty! Pizza is good too. Would recommend. Price is very reasonable too!

Staff was very friendly and worked well together. Was busy but they will managed to accommodate every table no matter how many people were or weren't sitting there. Food was delicious with plenty of options.

Very disappointed with the to-go service they provide. Ordered just one small bbq chicken pizza in advance to avoid waiting Waited a full hour for the order when the estimated wait time was only 20 minutes. I believe her name was Iris. A gentlemen "walked in" and placed an order 10 minutes after I had already been sitting for a while. After he received his order before me, I stood up and asked out about my order. It had been in the heating compartment below the register the whole time. She had only put a couple pizzas in there once. Didn't think much of it until she grabbed that gentlemens order straight from the cooks. My pizza had been sitting in there the whole time. I'm not one to make a scene but the food did not come out the way we were expecting it to because it had to be reheated. The restaurant was fairly busy but not busy enough for my pizza to take that long.
I like the variety of gourmet pizzas, fun drinks, fee Wi-Fi and casual but also fancy enough for dates atmosphere.

Usually, I like CPK...unless it's this particular LBC location.  The service here sucks ass.  The last two times that we were here, it took forever for the waitress to come greet us after we were seated.  We never get offered bread and have to ask for it.  The bread today was stale and my BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad was bland.  What sucks even more is that it's so convenient (3 blocks from home), we end up coming back anyways.  I hope the servers don't read this review and spit in our food.

we sat down, got free waters, asked the server whether or not their pasta noodles have egg in them, then when she went to go find out, we decided that there weren't all too many vegetarian options, let alone vegan options, so we bailed. i felt bad just leaving and not leaving a tip, because someone did that to me at my restaurant the other day. sorry cpk, and sorry cute waitress!

Believe it or not, there are some people who have never been to CPK because they think that it strictly serves pizza. Well, let me tell you, there is way more than that. I had the Pan Fried Salmon and it was off the hook!!! Get it blackened. Oh by the way, why is it that when a restaurant is practically empty, that's when service is the worst?? There were about 6 people in there and no one showed up at my table for about a good 10 minutes. I finally had to alert the greeter at the door who came and served me. OH BY THE WAY- If you have ever had the APPLEWOOD SMOKED bacon in one of their salads, you know that it is the BOMMMB!!!! Guess what, you can order that SAME bacon at:    You are welcome.
CPK is one of my favorite restaurants to eat at. And this location is the worst ever.If you like CPK don't  come to this location .Worst service just absolutely the worst service ever.
CPK has the best Tostada Pizza. dont get the jerk chicken pizza unless you like sweet nasty chicken. blech

Worst service at this location of any I have ever been to! This is one of my favorite restaurant chains to go to so my husband and I went to this location around 2:00 pm for a late lunch. I already knew what I wanted to order because I had been to this restaurant many times in Hawaii so this should have been a fast lunch. When we were walking in we saw a table of people from the patio get up and leave. When we got inside there was no host or hostess at the stand. when she appeared several minutes later she was very rude and when we asked to sit outside she said there were no seats outside for almost an hour (she did not even check outside) we pointed through the window at the empty table and said theres one we want to sit there. She said she could not seat us there for 10 minutes because it needed to get cleaned although there was no one ahead of us in line. After ten minutes, she took us to the empty table. Again, I already knew what I wanted to order and after the 10-20 minute wait at the front, my husband knew what he wanted to order. NO ONE came to our table to help us!! One male server passed by us to help the table next to us three different times, he never said hi or spoke to us at all. One female server passed us four times to help the tables on the other side of us and she also did not speak to us at all. The manager even came out to deliver food to a table and he said nothing to us either. We sat there for almost 30 minutes with closed menus and no one offered us drinks or even spoke to us. My husband asked the female server who our server was and asked for them to help us right away. No one did. Finally, when the male server passed us a fourth time, my husband had to very loudly ask for him to help us and the male server said I dont think you are my table and went inside. We proceeded to get up and leave after spending about an hour without getting any service during a time when the lunch crowd had already left. Although this id the closest location to us, we will NEVER go here again. I just joined yelp today so I could warn other people about how bad this location is and so no one else has to waste their time!

i love CKA, but this one has really bad service, it kind of fazed me last time i was there on a date, the servers were so slow getting our orders and they never came by to refill our beverages so it kind of ticked me off, plus there was really bad 80s music playing, the only good thing i have to say is that the food was terrific, i recommend the linguini marinara, it is delish :]
